2022年是迎難而上的一年。

2022年伊始，全球經濟環境一片暗淡。新冠病毒變異株Omicron肆虐，令全球經濟增長繼續受壓，通脹壓力亦持續上升。其後俄羅斯與烏克蘭爆發衝突，進一步推高通脹壓力，導致各主要央行採取前置式貨幣緊縮政策，擴大環球金融市場的波動，並加劇經濟增長放緩的風險。本地方面，第五波疫情爆發，感染個案急速上升，亦進一步打擊經濟。同時，圍繞防疫措施與檢疫限制的負面報道，更令外界對香港產生誤解，威脅香港作為國際金融中心的聲譽。全年計，香港實質本地生產總值收縮了3.5%。

儘管面對重重挑戰，金管局繼續致力保障香港貨幣與金融穩定，並於主要策略範疇推進多項有利發展的措施，進一步鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位。經歷3年的旅遊限制後，我們成功向國際社會展示香港已全面復常，旅客亦能再次親身訪港體驗。金管局在去年11月舉辦「國際金融領袖投資峰會」，來自世界各地的金融領袖親身來港出席。外界如此熱烈的反應，成為印證香港全面復常最好不過的證明。

展望未來，外圍環境仍然充滿前所未有的不確定性。儘管如此，內地經濟重啟會為香港以至整個地區重新注入動力。金管局將繼續緊守崗位，履行維持香港貨幣與銀行體系穩定的職能，並積極尋求更多有利香港發展的機會，展現及提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。我們亦會繼續為提升全球氣候應變能力及可持續發展出力。今年除《二零二二年年報》外，我們會另外發表《二零二二年可持續發展報告》，以便更詳細地介紹金管局在提升香港作為綠色和可持續金融樞紐的地位所進行的各項工作，以及金管局作為負責任投資者及可持續機構所作出的努力。

# 貨幣及金融體系：堅穩如昔

聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）自1983年實施至今，歷經多個經濟周期，成功抵禦各種各樣的外來衝擊。2022年再次見證聯匯制度的抗震能力。在美國聯邦儲備局（聯儲局）大幅收緊貨幣政策下，弱方兌換保證於2022年5月至11月期間被觸發41次，金管局按照既定機制，以有序及具透明度的方式從市場買入合共2,421億港元。其間港元匯率及貨幣市場繼續運作暢順，反映聯匯制度穩健有效。

這份對聯匯制度的信心，來自於建立多年的穩固根基。正如國際貨幣基金組織在其《2022年對外部門報告》中重申，聯匯制度的公信力建基於多項因素，包括具高透明度的運作規則、充裕的外匯儲備、審慎的財政制度、穩健的金融監管，以及靈活的經濟結構。

我們深信除了穩健的機制外，致力與公眾及市場溝通以加深其對聯匯制度的了解、進行有效的市場監察，以及就不同情景作出應變計劃，均有助鞏固各界對聯匯制度的信心。我們就聯匯制度運作機制推出的社交媒體宣傳活動，有助在年內弱方兌換保證多次被觸發的情況下，有效維護市場對聯匯制度的信心。內部方面，金管局亦善用數據分析技術加強市場監察，讓我們能適時回應最新市場形勢。

年內，儘管面對宏觀層面的挑戰以及遞增的信用風險，香港銀行體系仍然維持穩健，資本及流動性均非常充裕。2022年底，本地銀行的綜合總資本充足比率為20.1%，遠高於國際最低要求的8%。2022年第4季，大型銀行的流動性覆蓋比率稍升至162.3%，亦遠高於法定最低要求的100%。鑑於信貸環境面對挑戰，銀行體系的資產質素略為轉差，特定分類貸款比率於2022年底升至1.38%，但有關水平仍屬穩健，並低於2000年以來的長期平均水平1.8%。

# 銀行體系：有效監管確保運作穩健

疫情持續3年，來自各方面的挑戰均有所加劇，例如地緣政治緊張局勢升溫及主要央行收緊貨幣政策。然而，全賴多年來妥善的風險管理及有效的監管，香港銀行體系得以維持穩健，繼續發揮支持經濟的重要作用。

過去一年面對的一項主要監管挑戰，是在第五波新冠疫情後經濟仍充滿不確定性之下，確保銀行繼續為客戶提供所需支援的同時，維持穩健的信用風險管理。「預先批核還息不還本」計劃進一步展期，並加入自願性部分本金還款選項，讓借款人可以選擇開始償還部分本金，協助客戶就最終回復正常還款作好準備。

因應主要經濟體大幅收緊貨幣政策令市場波動加劇，2022年金管局另一項主要監管工作是加強監察銀行的市場及流動性風險承擔。我們深入評估各經濟體同步收緊貨幣政策對銀行可能產生的影響，並就壓力測試引入新情景，以評估銀行應對長時間流動性壓力的韌性。

與此同時，我們繼續採取具前瞻性的措施，促進在多個範疇的有效風險管理。在運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力方面，我們提供指引協助銀行制定綜合及全面的運作架構，以達致穩健經營，並就銀行具體的運作範疇提供詳盡監管指引，例如因應雲端技術普及而就使用雲端運算提供指引。此外，因應數碼化加速發展，我們亦加強了應對「網絡釣魚」騙案和推進消費者及投資者保障的工作。

除了維持銀行體系穩健外，金管局亦致力推動普及金融及提高銀行服務的便利性。銀行對於金管局就提供基本銀行服務的呼籲反應正面，有銀行在新發展地區的大型公共屋邨增設分行及自助銀行服務設施。受到疫情相關的旅遊限制影響，許多香港市民無法使用其內地銀行戶口。有見及此，金管局與有關各方緊密合作，協助重新啓動約50萬個內地銀行戶口，受影響戶口持有人無需親身前往內地辦理。

另一個對銀行業持續發展具策略重要性的範疇是提升專業能力。為擴展業務，銀行業對專業人才的需求仍然龐大。金管局在其人才發展策略 — 「連接人才與未來」— 的基礎上，在過去一年推出多項措施，協助銀行業吸引、培育及挽留人才，集中提升及再培訓現有從業員的技能，以及培育年輕一代，以建立可持續的人才庫。

# 國際金融中心：香港重回國際舞台!

實施多時的疫情相關旅遊限制於2022年逐步撤銷，我們作出了多方面的努力讓香港重回國際舞台。11月舉行的「國際金融領袖投資峰會」吸引超過200位來自環球金融機構的國際及地區負責人親臨香港，並獲得全球各地的關注及熱切迴響。儘管峰會舉行日期不巧遇上50年來首個在11月份發出的8號颱風訊號，峰會仍然十分成功，向世界傳遞了香港已全面復常並正展現無比朝氣與活力的有力訊息。我們很高興看到峰會產生了正面的漣漪效應，不少環球金融機構及國際組織現正或計劃在香港舉辦各類活動。

除吸引各地訪客重臨香港外，我和金管局的同事體會到面對面交流聯繫的重要性，因此盡可能親身代表香港出席主要國際會議，積極參與全球政策討論，並藉外訪機會與環球金融機構的集團管理層會面，加深他們對香港穩健的金融體系以及在「一國兩制」下香港提供的各種機遇的了解。

為確保香港保持作為國際金融中心的競爭力，我們在金融科技、內地機遇，以及綠色和可持續金融等策略性重點領域不斷開拓市場新界限。我們亦進一步加強本港的金融平台，提供頂尖的服務，吸引更多企業落戶香港。有關金管局在綠色和可持續金融方面的工作詳情，請參閱《二零二二年可持續發展報告》。

# 金融科技

繼2021年6月公布「金融科技2025」策略，2022年我們在五大範疇均取得顯著進展。

我們在「全面推展銀行數碼化」方面的工作取得理想成果。根據金融科技應用評估的結果，香港銀行業在不同業務領域廣泛採用金融科技，而且所採用的科技類別亦持續增加。我們自2017年以來逐步推廣及支持數碼化的工作獲銀行積極回應，並持續取得成果，成續令人鼓舞。我們將繼續與業界緊密合作，根據評估的結果，進一步推動金融科技在特定銀行業務領域的應用及促進個別科技類別的發展。

年內我們在央行數碼貨幣方面的工作邁進重要的新里程。「多種央行數碼貨幣跨境網絡」(mBridge)項目進入試行階段，並成為全球其中一個率先為企業跨境交易進行真實結算的央行數碼貨幣項目。在零售層面，數字人民幣跨境使用的技術測試已進入第二階段，主要測試通過「轉數快」為數字人民幣錢包增值。數碼港元方面，我們將採取三軌道方式為將來可能發行數碼港元作好準備，並推出第二軌道先導計劃，邀請業界深入研究數碼港元可行的應用場景。

數據可全面釋放金融科技的潛力。我們於去年10月推出的「商業數據通」正是提升香港數據基建的重要一步。作為以數據擁有人授權為本的共享數據基建，「商業數據通」能方便金融機構提取企業的商業數據，使企業（尤其中小型企業）更容易獲得融資。截至2022年底，「商業數據通」已促成超過1,000宗中小企貸款，總額逾19億港元。

最後，我們在擁抱金融創新和它帶來的好處的同時，亦明白有必要監察及處理好相關發展可能帶來的風險。我們正密切注視虛擬資產領域的發展，並參與相關監管事宜的國際討論。經考慮公眾諮詢收集到的意見及相關國際標準後，我們將採納「相同風險，相同監管」1 的方式制定穩定幣的監管制度及界定其監管範圍。未來我們率先規管的對象將是那些標榜與一種或以上法定貨幣的價值掛鈎的穩定幣，因為這類穩定幣可能對貨幣及金融穩定帶來更高及更迫切的潛在風險。我們相信在訂立適當的規範下，業界將可更安全穩妥地開拓數碼金融的潛力。

科技正重塑我們的未來。金管局與銀行業界正積極準備迎向這個「新常態」。我們有信心我們正構建的金融科技生態圈將有助全面釋放金融科技的潛力，並提升香港作為國際金融中心的競爭力。

2022 was a year of facing challenges head-on.

At the beginning of 2022, the global economic environment remained bleak. The Omicron variant of the novel coronavirus spread widely, continuing to weigh on global economic growth and inflationary pressures. Subsequently, the conflict between Russia and Ukraine further intensified inflationary pressures, prompting major central banks to adopt preemptive monetary tightening policies, increasing volatility in global financial markets and exacerbating risks of economic slowdown. Locally, the fifth wave of the pandemic broke out, causing a sharp rise in infection cases and further undermining the economy. Meanwhile, negative media coverage surrounding anti-pandemic measures and quarantine restrictions led to misunderstandings about Hong Kong, threatening its reputation as an international financial center. Throughout the year, Hong Kong's real gross domestic product contracted by 3.5%.

Despite these numerous challenges, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continued to strive to safeguard Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability, advancing multiple development-oriented initiatives across key strategic areas, further consolidating Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre. After three years of travel restrictions, we successfully demonstrated to the international community that Hong Kong has fully resumed normal operations, allowing visitors to experience the city firsthand again. In November last year, the HKMA hosted the Global Financial Leaders' Investment Summit, where financial leaders from around the world attended in person. This enthusiastic response from the outside world served as the best proof of Hong Kong's full resumption.

Looking ahead, the external environment remains fraught with unprecedented uncertainties. Nevertheless, the restart of the mainland economy will inject new momentum into Hong Kong and the entire region. The HKMA will continue to fulfill its role in maintaining Hong Kong's monetary and banking system stability, actively seeking more opportunities conducive to Hong Kong's development, and demonstrating and enhancing Hong Kong's competitiveness as an international financial centre. We will also continue to contribute to improving global climate resilience and sustainability. In addition to the Annual Report 2022, we will issue a separate Sustainable Development Report 2022 to provide a more detailed introduction to the various initiatives undertaken by the HKMA to enhance Hong Kong's status as a green and sustainable financial hub, as well as the efforts made by the HKMA as a responsible investor and sustainable organisation.

# Currency and Financial System: Steady as Ever

The Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS), implemented since 1983, has successfully withstood various external shocks through multiple economic cycles. 2022 once again witnessed the resilience of the LERS. Under the US Federal Reserve's significant tightening of monetary policy, the weak-side Convertibility Undertaking (CU) was triggered 41 times between May and November 2022, and the HKMA purchased a total of HK$242.1 billion from the market in an orderly and transparent manner according to the established mechanism. During this period, the HK dollar exchange rate and currency markets continued to function smoothly, reflecting the robustness and effectiveness of the LERS.

This confidence in the LERS stems from its long-established solid foundation. As reiterated by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) in its External Sector Report 2022, the credibility of the LERS is built on several factors, including high transparency in operational rules, ample foreign exchange reserves, prudent fiscal arrangements, sound financial regulation, and a flexible economic structure.

We believe that apart from a sound mechanism, efforts to communicate effectively with the public and market participants to deepen their understanding of the LERS, conduct effective market surveillance, and prepare contingency plans for different scenarios can help strengthen confidence in the LERS. Our social media campaign promoting the operation mechanism of the LERS helped maintain market confidence in the LERS during the frequent triggering of the weak-side CU throughout the year. Internally, the HKMA also leveraged data analytics technology to enhance market surveillance, enabling us to respond timely to the latest market developments.

Throughout the year, despite macro-level challenges and increasing credit risks, the banking system in Hong Kong maintained its strength, with capital and liquidity remaining abundant. At the end of 2022, the comprehensive capital adequacy ratio of local banks stood at 20.1%, far exceeding the international minimum requirement of 8%. In the fourth quarter of 2022, the liquidity coverage ratio of large banks slightly increased to 162.3%, also significantly above the statutory minimum requirement of 100%. Given the challenging credit environment, the asset quality of the banking system showed slight deterioration, with the classified loan ratio rising to 1.38% at the end of 2022. However, this level remained stable and below the long-term average of 1.8% since 2000.

# Banking System: Effective Regulation Ensures Stable Operations

The pandemic persisted for three years, intensifying challenges from various fronts, such as escalating geopolitical tensions and tighter monetary policies by major central banks. Nonetheless, thanks to years of sound risk management and effective regulation, the Hong Kong banking system remained resilient and continued to play an important role in supporting the economy.

One of the main regulatory challenges faced over the past year was ensuring that banks could continue providing necessary support to customers while maintaining sound credit risk management amid the uncertainty following the fifth wave of the pandemic. The "Interest-only Payment Extension Scheme" was further extended and included a voluntary partial principal repayment option, allowing borrowers to choose to start repaying part of the principal and helping customers prepare for the eventual return to regular repayments.

In response to the heightened market volatility caused by the significant tightening of monetary policies in major economies, another key regulatory task for the HKMA in 2022 was strengthening monitoring of banks' exposure to market and liquidity risks. We conducted in-depth assessments of the potential impacts of synchronized monetary tightening by major economies on banks and introduced new stress-testing scenarios to evaluate banks' resilience against prolonged liquidity pressures.

Meanwhile, we continued to take proactive measures to promote effective risk management across multiple areas. Regarding operational resilience and cyber resilience, we provided guidance to help banks develop comprehensive and robust operational frameworks to achieve stable operations, and offered detailed regulatory guidelines for specific operational areas, such as guidance on the use of cloud computing due to the widespread adoption of cloud technologies. Additionally, in response to the accelerated digitalization, we enhanced our efforts against phishing scams and consumer and investor protection.

Beyond maintaining a sound banking system, the HKMA also focused on promoting financial inclusion and improving the convenience of bank services. Banks responded positively to the HKMA's call for providing basic banking services, with some banks setting up branches and self-service facilities in large public housing estates in newly developed areas. Affected by pandemic-related travel restrictions, many Hong Kong residents were unable to access their Mainland accounts. In response, the HKMA worked closely with relevant parties to re-enable approximately 500,000 Mainland accounts, allowing affected account holders to do so without having to visit the Mainland in person.

Another strategically important area for the sustained development of the banking sector is capacity building. With the demand for professional talent still strong for expanding business operations, the HKMA launched multiple measures in the past year under its talent development strategy "Connecting Talent with the Future," to assist the banking industry in attracting, cultivating, and retaining talent. These measures focus on upgrading and retraining existing staff skills, as well as nurturing the next generation to build a sustainable talent pool.

# International Financial Centre: Hong Kong Reclaims Its Place on the World Stage!

After the gradual removal of pandemic-related travel restrictions, we made extensive efforts to bring Hong Kong back onto the global stage. The Global Financial Leaders' Investment Summit held in November attracted over 200 senior representatives from global financial institutions, receiving wide attention and enthusiastic responses worldwide. Despite the inconvenient timing of the summit coinciding with the first No. 8 typhoon signal issued in November in 50 years, the event was highly successful, conveying a powerful message that Hong Kong has fully resumed normal operations and is showing immense vitality and energy. We are pleased to see the positive ripple effects generated by the summit, with many global financial institutions and international organizations currently or planning to hold various events in Hong Kong.

In addition to welcoming visitors back to Hong Kong, I and my colleagues at the HKMA have come to appreciate the importance of face-to-face interactions. Therefore, we have endeavored to personally represent Hong Kong at major international conferences, actively participate in global policy discussions, and meet with group executives of global financial institutions during overseas visits to deepen their understanding of Hong Kong's sound financial system and the various opportunities available under the "one country, two systems" framework.

To ensure Hong Kong maintains its competitiveness as an international financial centre, we have continuously expanded our market boundaries in strategic priority areas such as fintech, mainland opportunities, green and sustainable finance, and other key sectors. We have also further strengthened Hong Kong's financial platform, offering top-tier services to attract more businesses to establish themselves in Hong Kong. Details of the HKMA's work in green and sustainable finance can be found in the Sustainability Report 2022.

# Fintech

Following the announcement of the Fintech 2025 Strategy in June 2021, we achieved significant progress in five key areas in 2022.

Our work in "comprehensively advancing banking digitisation" yielded promising results. According to the assessment of fintech applications, the banking sector in Hong Kong extensively adopted fintech across various business areas, and the types of technologies used continued to expand. Since 2017, our gradual promotion and support of digitisation received active responses from the banking industry, and continuous achievements have been made, with encouraging outcomes. We will continue to work closely with the industry based on the assessment results to further advance the application of fintech in specific banking business areas and promote the development of individual technology categories.

During the year, we made significant progress in central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). The Multi-CBDC Bridge (mBridge) project entered the pilot phase and became one of the first global CBDC projects to conduct real-time settlements for corporate cross-border transactions. On the retail front, the technological testing of cross-border usage of e-CNY wallets entered its second phase, primarily focusing on testing the ability to top-up e-CNY wallets via the Faster Payment System (FPS). Regarding e-HKD, we took a three-track approach to prepare for the possible issuance of e-HKD and launched the second track pilot programme, inviting the industry to deeply explore feasible application scenarios for e-HKD.

Data plays a crucial role in unlocking the potential of fintech. The launch of the Business Data Gateway in October last year marked an important step in enhancing Hong Kong's data infrastructure. As a shared data infrastructure based on data owner authorization, the Business Data Gateway enables financial institutions to easily extract commercial data from enterprises, making it easier for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to obtain financing. By the end of 2022, the Business Data Gateway had facilitated over 1,000 SME loans amounting to more than HK$1.9 billion.

Finally, while embracing financial innovation and its benefits, we recognize the need to monitor and manage related developments' potential risks. We are closely watching developments in the virtual assets space and participating in international discussions on relevant regulatory matters. After considering public consultation feedback and relevant international standards, we will adopt the "same risk, same regulation" principle to formulate a regulatory framework for stablecoins and define their regulatory scope. In the future, we will first regulate stablecoins that claim to be pegged to the value of one or more fiat currencies, as these stablecoins may pose higher and more urgent potential risks to monetary and financial stability. We believe that with appropriate regulations in place, the industry will be able to safely and steadily explore the potential of digital finance.

Technology is reshaping our future. The HKMA and the banking industry are actively preparing for this "new normal." We are confident that the fintech ecosystem we are building will help fully unlock the potential of fintech and enhance Hong Kong's competitiveness as an international financial centre.

# 2022年摘要

# 經濟及金融環境

受第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境等多項不利因素的影響，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場首先轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

香港銀行體系在2022年繼續保持穩健，資本及流動性狀況維持充裕，資產質素繼續處於健康水平。

# 貨幣穩定

隨着美國收緊貨幣政策，港元轉弱，弱方兌換保證於年內被多次觸發。然而，港元外匯及貨幣市場繼續保持有序及暢順運作，一再證明聯繫匯率制度穩健有效。

# 儲備管理

2022年的投資環境異常動盪，多種資產類別的價格同時下挫，外匯基金錄得整體投資回報率為負4.5%，與市場上大部分多元資產基金的表現相比，虧損幅度相對溫和。

金管局亦繼續致力推動負責任投資及資產多元化。與此同時，長期增長組合自2009年開展投資以來的內部回報率年率為12.6%。

# 銀行體系穩定

面對金融市場波動擴大，金管局加強對銀行的信用及市場風險管理的監管，並與銀行緊密合作，提升銀行的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力，以應對網絡威脅持續增加及銀行業數碼轉型步伐加快的情況。

金管局進一步推出有關「先買後付」產品及新增物業轉按支付安排的消費者保障措施。此外，金管局與其他監管機構合作制定虛擬資產監管架構，並就分銷投資產品發出指引及推出全新的信託業務監管制度。有關個人信貸資料的「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」亦於年內啟用。

金管局繼續與銀行合作提升香港的打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統，並加強對騙案的回應措施，又透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」系列進一步推動數據與科技的應用，以及加快金管局就反洗錢工作採用監管科技的步伐。

金管局在本地實施有關資本充足標準及披露標準等國際監管標準方面取得良好進展。金管局亦與銀行業共同為未來發展努力建立可持續的人才庫及提升從業員的技能。

為確保香港備有具公信力的處置機制，金管局制定新處置標準，又進行地區危機模擬演習，並在所有具本地系統重要性銀行建立一層新的吸收虧損能力資源，為處置機制的發展立下重要的里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

「國際金融領袖投資峰會」取得成功，鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，並製造正面的漣漪效應。

中國人民銀行與金管局之間的貨幣互換協議於年內優化，進一步鞏固香港作為全球離岸人民幣業務樞紐的地位。金管局亦與其他監管機構及持份者合作，籌備開通「互換通」，及推出配合人民幣計價股票在港交易的雙櫃台莊家機制。另又致力發展債務工具中央結算系統成為亞洲區主要的國際中央證券託管平台。

在加強香港金融平台的競爭力方面取得良好進展，涵蓋債券發行、資產及財富管理、企業財資中心，以及綠色和可持續金融等範疇。

金管局亦繼續推行「金融科技2025」策略，促進金融業界採用金融科技，並提升香港作為金融科技樞紐的地位。快速支付系統「轉數快」隨着功能提升，使用量穩步增長。

# 機構職能

金管局透過不同渠道與社會及市場保持有效聯繫，提升公眾對金管局政策及工作的了解。

對內，金管局悉心建立一支強調靈活應變及可持續發展的工作團隊，同時遵守嚴格的財政紀律及提升資訊科技能力，應對變化及確保有效執行各項政策及措施。

# Summary of 2022

# Economic and Financial Environment

Due to multiple adverse factors including the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, tighter financial conditions, and a challenging external environment, Hong Kong's economy contracted significantly in 2022. The labor market initially deteriorated before gradually improving, while inflation remained moderate. With the full resumption of border crossings between the Mainland and Hong Kong, it is expected that Hong Kong's economic growth will recover from its low base in 2023.

Hong Kong's banking system continued to maintain soundness in 2022, with ample capital and liquidity positions, and asset quality remained at healthy levels.

# Monetary Stability

With the tightening of US monetary policy, the Hong Kong dollar weakened, resulting in multiple triggers of the weak-side exchange mechanism during the year. However, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and money markets continued to operate orderly and smoothly, once again demonstrating the robustness and effectiveness of the Linked Exchange Rate System.

# Reserve Management

The investment environment in 2022 was exceptionally volatile, with prices across various asset classes declining simultaneously. The Exchange Fund recorded an overall investment return of -4.5%, which represented relatively modest losses compared to the performance of most multi-asset funds in the market.

The HKMA continued to promote responsible investment and portfolio diversification. At the same time, the Long-Term Growth Portfolio (LTGP), which has been investing since its inception in 2009, achieved an annualised internal rate of return of 12.6%.

# Banking System Stability

Faced with expanding financial market volatility, the HKMA enhanced its oversight of banks' credit and market risk management, and worked closely with banks to improve their operational resilience and cyber security capabilities to address the increasing cyber threats and accelerated digital transformation in the banking sector.

The HKMA further introduced consumer protection measures regarding "Buy Now, Pay Later" (BNPL) products and new mortgage refinancing arrangements. In addition, the HKMA collaborated with other regulators to develop a regulatory framework for virtual assets, issued guidance on the distribution of investment products, and launched a new regulatory regime for trust businesses. The Credit Reference Platform under the Multiple Credit Reference Agencies (MCRAs) model for consumer credit data was also implemented during the year.

The HKMA continues to work with banks to enhance Hong Kong's anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing (AML/CFT) ecosystem, and strengthen response measures against fraud. Through the series of AML Regtech Labs, the HKMA further promotes the application of data and technology, and accelerates the adoption of regulatory technology (Regtech) in AML efforts.

The HKMA made good progress in implementing international supervisory standards, including capital adequacy and disclosure standards. The HKMA also works with the banking industry to build a sustainable talent pool and enhance staff skills.

To ensure Hong Kong has a credible resolution regime, the HKMA developed new resolution standards, conducted regional crisis simulation exercises, and established a new layer of loss-absorbing capacity resources in all domestic systemically important banks, marking an important milestone in the development of the resolution regime.

# Hong Kong's Status as an International Financial Centre

The successful holding of the Global Financial Leaders’ Investment Summit reinforced Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre and generated positive ripple effects.

The Currency Swap Agreement between the People's Bank of China (PBoC) and the HKMA was optimised during the year, further strengthening Hong Kong's position as a global offshore renminbi (RMB) business hub. The HKMA also collaborated with other regulators and stakeholders to prepare for the launch of Swap Connect, and introduced the Dual Counter Market Making (DCMM) regime to support trading of RMB-denominated stocks in Hong Kong. Additionally, the HKMA continues to develop the Central Moneymarkets Unit (CMU) as a major international central securities depository platform in Asia.

In enhancing Hong Kong's financial infrastructure competitiveness, significant progress has been made across areas including bond issuance, asset and wealth management, corporate treasury centres, and Green and Sustainable Finance.

The HKMA continues to implement the Fintech 2025 strategy, promoting the adoption of financial technology by the financial sector and enhancing Hong Kong's position as a fintech hub. The Faster Payment System ("FPS") has seen steady growth in usage as its functionalities have been enhanced.

# Corporate Functions

The HKMA maintains effective communication channels with society and the market to enhance public understanding of its policies and operations.

Internally, the HKMA has built a workforce that emphasizes flexibility and sustainability, while adhering to strict financial discipline and enhancing information technology capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of policies and measures.

# 2022年大事紀要

# 貨幣穩定

# 5月26日

政府於「機構債券發行計劃」下以投標方式首次發行5億港元的20年期港元政府債券。

# 7月4日

中國人民銀行（人民銀行）與金管局公布優化貨幣互換協議，改為常備協議形式，毋須續期，協議規模並由原來的5,000億元人民幣╱5,900億元港幣擴大至8,000億元人民幣╱9,400億元港幣。

# 7月13日

金管局發出《全球外匯市場準則》的更新承諾聲明，藉以重申承諾在外匯市場以市場參與者身分行事時會遵守該準則的更新版本。

# 7月22日

金管局公布優化人民幣流動資金安排，包括擴大規模及簡化操作。

# 銀行體系

# 1月28日

金管局與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）發出聯合通函，就中介人從事虛擬資產相關活動提供更新指引以保障客戶。

# 1月28日

金管局就銀行管理與虛擬資產及虛擬資產服務提供者相關的洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險的監管指引作出更新。

# 2月8日

金管局宣布延長「銀行業人才起動計劃」6個月。

# 2月23日

香港按揭證券有限公司（按揭證券公司）全資擁有的香港按證保險有限公司（按證保險公司）宣布，按揭保險計劃就已落成住宅物業作出修訂及擴大適用範

# 2月23日

「百分百擔保個人特惠貸款計劃」推出優化措施（4月19日生效），並將申請期延長至2023年4月底。

# 2月23日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至10月底，貿易融資貸款本金還款期則可獲延長90天。計劃亦同時提供一個為期一年的部分本金還款選項，讓有意願和有能力的借款人逐步回復正常還款。

「中小企融資擔保計劃」亦推出優化措施（4月1日生效），並將申請期延長至2023年6月30日。

# 4月1日

金管局及保險業監管局（保監局）推出措施就利用保費融資投購人壽保單加強客戶保障。

# 4月14日

金管局就協助香港市民在因疫情而實施的檢疫限制下重新啟動其內地銀行帳戶，向香港銀行發出指引。

# 4月26日

金管局推出「合規科技資訊平台」，以鼓勵香港合規科技生態圈加強在應用合規科技方面的經驗及專門知識交流。

# 4月28日

金管局宣布與銀行業聯合推出「銀行業畢業生培訓計劃」，為銀行業的快速增長領域擴大人才庫。

# 5月5日

金管局認可由香港銀行公會（銀行公會）和接受存款公司公會將實施的「強制性背景查核計劃」，旨在處理香港銀行業中「滾動的壞蘋果」現象。

# 5月6日

「百分百擔保個人特惠貸款計劃」開始接受個別受暫緩追討欠租安排影響的業主申請，直至10月31日。

# 5月25日

金管局發表《零售銀行前線部門獎勵制度專題評估》的報告（英文版），以持續推動銀行業穩善文化。

# 5月27日

金管局發出《信託業務營運守則》及相關的《監管政策手冊》新單元，以加強規管與監管香港信託業務。

# 5月31日

按揭證券公司全資擁有的香港年金有限公司宣布，香港年金計劃推出優化措施及推廣優惠。優化措施包括提高「醫療和牙科開支特別款項提取」金額上限及個人保費總金額上限。

# 6月23日

金管局發布金融科技應用評估的結果及相關工作計劃，以進一步支持業界應用金融科技。

# 7月1日

為實施巴塞爾委員會的「銀行於基金的股權投資的資本要求」而制定的《2022年銀行業（資本）（修訂）規則》生效。

# 7月6至8日

金管局參與設計和執行為期3日的區域危機模擬演習。該演習共涉及10間亞太區的中央銀行、監管和處置當局以及存款保險機構，旨在加強跨境合作。

# 7月8日

金管局就認可機構銷售保障型投資相連壽險提供指引，為客戶提供保障。

# 7月8日

金管局根據政府發表的《2022年香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估報告》所概述的主要見解及相關影響，向銀行及儲值支付工具持牌人發出指引。

# 7月20日

金管局歡迎銀行公會公布就住宅物業轉按交易提供多一種支付安排予客戶選擇。按揭銀行於11月7日開始提供該項新增的物業交易支付安排。

# 7月21日

金管局與數碼港在德勤協助下，合辦第二次「反洗錢合規科技實驗室(AMLab 2)，主要聚焦門檻較低及容易落實的「易用科技」。

# 9月2日

金管局就銀行的「先買後付」產品推出一系列消費者保護措施，以推動負責任借貸。

# 9月8日

金管局宣布推出一站式網上資源平台「銀行業導航」及第二屆「銀行業銜接課程」。

# 9月16日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃3個月至2023年1月底。

同日，按證保險公司宣布，「中小企融資擔保計劃」下的還息不還本安排亦相應延長，借款企業可申請延遲償還本金合共最多36個月。

# 9月26日

金管局敲定「金融科技從業員培訓資助先導計劃」的實施細則，並正式在銀行業界啟動計劃。

# 9月27日

證監會與金管局發表有關持牌法團和註冊機構銷售非交易所買賣投資產品的第二次年度聯合調查結果，共有327間持牌法團及63間註冊機構呈報它們在2021年內銷售投資產品的相關數據，總交易額達50,150億港元，參與的投資者增加5%至770,000名。

# 9月27日

金管局在「銀行專業資歷架構」下推出「合規」單元，與銀行業界合作制定一套可供業界共同採用和具透明度的能力標準，以提升從事合規工作的從業員的專業能力。

# 10月6日

金管局聯同銀行公會、銀行及儲值支付工具業界支持香港警務處推出詐騙陷阱搜尋器「防騙視伏器」，以加強預防、偵測及制止社會上的詐騙行為及減少公眾的財務損失。

除了發出實務指引和更新相關的「常見問題」外，金管局亦與銀行及儲值支付工具業界合作，通過網頁及社交媒體上的消費者教育資訊，提高公眾的防騙意識，並發布《匯思》文章闡述這方面的工作。

# 10月20日

金管局聯同「銀行業中小企貸款協調機制」宣布，延長「預先批核還息不還本」計劃6個月至2023年7月底，並優化部分本金還款選項，協助有能力的企業準備日後逐步回復正常還款。

按證保險公司亦宣布，「中小企融資擔保計劃」下還息不還本安排的申請期延長6個月至2023年6月底，上限則延長6個月至合共最多42個月。

# 10月21日

金管局發出兩份通告，以更新銷售及分銷彌補虧損產品的相關要求，及就合適性評估提供指引。

# 11月24日

金管局與數碼港合作，並由德勤協助，舉辦第三次「反洗錢合規科技實驗室(AMLab 3)。AMLab 3建基於過往AMLab系列的成果，運用網絡分析應對欺詐風險及減低傀儡戶口網絡騙案所造成的損失。

# 11月28日

在金管局的大力支持下，「多間信貸資料服務機構」模式下的「信貸資料平台」開始運作，以提升香港個人信貸資料服務機構的服務水平，並減低現時因市場只有一間商業營運的服務提供者而衍生的營運風險。

# 12月7日

金管局就將於2023年6月生效的《2022年打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（修訂）條例草案》向銀行發出通告，闡明與銀行業相關的最新修訂。

# 12月15日

金管局為銀行及儲值支付工具業界舉辦打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）講座，內容涵蓋監管要求的更新、反洗錢監管科技和合規科技、財富來源的監管要求、可疑交易報告的反饋及打擊大規模毀滅武器擴散資金籌集風險的更新。

# 12月23日

金管局、保監局和強制性公積金計劃管理局聯合發布通函，概述3間監管機構首度聯合展開有關中介人銷售兩種可扣稅產品手法（即合資格延期年金保單和強制性公積金可扣稅自願性供款）的喬裝客戶檢查計劃的主要結果和從中觀察到的良好做法。

# 12月31日

所有香港的具本地系統重要性銀行已建立一層新的財務資源以備在處置時吸收虧損，標誌着金管局在提升這類銀行的處置可行性及銀行體系穩健性上立下里程碑。

# 香港的國際金融中心地位

# 1月12日

金管局發布一份關於加密資產和穩定幣的討論文件，文件闡述了金管局就加密資產，尤其是用作支付用途的穩定幣的監管模式的構思，並邀請業界和公眾就有關的監管模式提出意見。

# 1月27日

金管局與瑞士聯邦財政部轄下的瑞士聯邦國際金融事務秘書處在線上合辦第五次香港與瑞士金融合作對話。

# 2月

金管局再次獲任命為財務行動特別組織轄下評估及合規小組聯席主席，任期兩年。財務行動特別組織是反洗錢全球標準制定組織。

# 2月11日

按揭證券公司宣布與14間合作銀行簽訂基建貸款合作框架《諒解備忘錄》，就基建貸款上的合作定立主要準則。

# 2月14日

金融學院轄下負責研究工作的香港貨幣及金融研究中心發表新一份題為《人口轉變及長期資產市場：香港的機遇及發展》的應用金融研究報告（英文版）。

# 3月8日

國際貨幣基金組織（基金組織）代表團就香港特別行政區2022年第四條磋商發表評估報告，再次肯定香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位，具備穩健強韌的金融體系、有效的宏觀經濟及審慎政策，以及健全的規管及監管框架，並認同香港金融業在疫情期間，依然持續擴張和發展。

基金組織亦讚揚香港在應對氣候變化方面取得重大進展，並認同政府努力不懈加強綠色和可持續金融生態圈。

# 3月30日

綠色和可持續金融跨機構督導小組公布對香港碳市場機遇的初步可行性評估。根據評估結果，督導小組公布支持香港發展成為區域碳交易中心的後續工作。

# 4月12日

香港貨幣及金融研究中心與金融學院合辦「宏觀經濟最新發展、美聯儲收緊貨幣政策及離岸人民幣市場的發展」線上研討會，吸引84萬人次在線參與。

# 4月27日

金管局發布題為《從政策及設計角度看「數碼港元」》的討論文件，闡述在香港引入零售層面央行數碼貨幣（即「數碼港元」或e-HKD）所涉及的主要政策及設計事項，並徵求意見。

# 5月3日

金管局和世界銀行集團成員國際金融公司共同發起的「綠色商業銀行聯盟」與渣打銀行於網上合辦「綠色及可持續資本市場蛻變圓桌會議」。

# 2022 Highlights

# Monetary Stability

# May 26

The Government made its debut issuance of HK$5 billion 20-year Hong Kong dollar government bonds under the Institutional Bond Issuance Programme through a bidding process.

# July 4

The People's Bank of China (PBoC) and the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) announced the optimization of the currency swap agreement, converting it into a standing arrangement without the need for renewal. The scale of the agreement was expanded from RMB 500 billion / HKD 590 billion to RMB 800 billion / HKD 940 billion.

# July 13

The HKMA issued an updated Statement of Commitment regarding the Foreign Exchange Global Code, reiterating its commitment to abide by the updated version when acting as a market participant in the foreign exchange market.

# July 22

The HKMA announced the optimization of the Renminbi liquidity arrangements, including expanding the scale and simplifying operations.

# Banking System

# January 28

The HKMA and the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) issued a joint circular providing updated guidance for intermediaries engaging in virtual asset-related activities to protect customers.

# January 28

The HKMA updated supervisory guidance on money laundering and terrorist financing risks associated with virtual assets and virtual asset service providers for banks.

# February 8

The HKMA announced the extension of the Banking Talent Programme by six months.

# February 23

The Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation Limited (HKMC), a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation, announced revisions and expansion of the mortgage insurance programme for completed residential properties.

# February 23

The Personal Loan Guarantee Scheme (PLGS) introduced optimized measures (effective April 19) and extended the application period to the end of April 2023.

# February 23

The HKMA, together with the Banking Sector Small and Medium-sized Enterprise (SME) Lending Coordination Mechanism, announced the extension of the "Pre-approved Interest-only Repayment" scheme by six months until the end of October, with trade finance loan principal repayment periods extended by 90 days. The scheme also provided a one-year partial principal repayment option, allowing borrowers who have the willingness and ability to gradually resume normal repayments.

The SME Financing Guarantee Scheme (SFGS) also introduced optimized measures (effective April 1) and extended the application period to June 30, 2023.

# April 1

The HKMA and the Insurance Authority (IA) launched measures to enhance customer protection concerning the use of premium financing to purchase life insurance policies.

# April 14

The HKMA issued guidelines to help Hong Kong residents reactivate their Mainland bank accounts amid quarantine restrictions due to the pandemic.

# April 26

The HKMA launched the Compliance Tech Information Platform to encourage the development of the RegTech ecosystem in Hong Kong by facilitating experience sharing and knowledge exchange in the application of RegTech.

# April 28

The HKMA announced the launch of the Banking Graduate Trainee Programme in collaboration with the banking sector to expand the talent pool in rapidly growing areas of the banking industry.

# May 5

The HKMA approved the implementation of the Mandatory Reference Checking Scheme by the Hong Kong Association of Banks (HKAB) and the Deposit-Taking Companies Association, aimed at addressing the issue of "rolling bad apples" in the Hong Kong banking sector.

# May 6

The Personal Loan Guarantee Scheme (PLGS) began accepting applications from individual property owners affected by the rental enforcement moratorium, until October 31.

# May 25

The HKMA published the Report of the Focused Review on Incentive Systems of Front Offices in Retail Banks (in English) to continuously promote a sound culture within the banking industry.

# May 27

The HKMA issued the Trust Business Operations Code and related new sections of the Supervisory Policy Manual (SPM) to strengthen regulation and oversight of trust businesses in Hong Kong.

# May 31

HKMC Annuity Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Hong Kong Mortgage Corporation, announced the introduction of optimized measures and promotional offers for the HKMC Annuity Plan. The optimizations included increasing the upper limit for special withdrawals for medical and dental expenses and the total annual premium amount.

# June 23

The HKMA released the results of the assessment of financial technology (fintech) applications and related work plans to further support the industry's adoption of fintech.

# July 1

The Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2022, formulated to implement the Basel Committee's "Capital Requirements for Equity Investments in Funds," came into effect.

# July 6-8

The HKMA participated in the design and execution of a three-day regional crisis simulation exercise involving 10 central banks, regulators, and resolution authorities across Asia-Pacific, aiming to enhance cross-border cooperation.

# July 8

The HKMA issued guidance for authorized institutions on selling protected investment-linked life insurance products to provide customer protection.

# July 8

The HKMA issued guidance to banks and stored value facility (SVF) licensees based on the key findings and relevant implications outlined in the Hong Kong Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing Report 2022.

# July 20

The HKMA welcomed the announcement by the HKAB regarding the provision of an additional payment arrangement for property transactions to customers. The mortgage banks started offering this new property transaction payment arrangement from November 7.

# July 21

The HKMA, in collaboration with Cyberport with Deloitte's assistance, held the second Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulatory Technology Lab (AMLab 2), focusing primarily on "user-friendly technologies" with lower thresholds and easier implementation.

# September 2

The HKMA introduced a series of consumer protection measures for "buy now, pay later" (BNPL) products to promote responsible lending.

# September 8

The HKMA announced the launch of a one-stop online resource platform "Banking GPS" and the second cohort of the Future Banking Bridging Programme.

# September 16

The HKMA, together with the Banking Sector SME Lending Coordination Mechanism, announced the extension of the "Pre-approved Interest-only Repayment" scheme by three months until the end of January 2023.

On the same day, HKMC Insurance Company Limited announced that the interest-only repayment arrangement under the SME Financing Guarantee Scheme (SFGS) would also be extended accordingly, allowing borrowing enterprises to apply for a principal moratorium of up to 36 months.

# September 26

The HKMA finalized the implementation details of the "RegTech Training Subsidy Pilot Programme" and officially launched the initiative in the banking sector.

# September 27

The SFC and the HKMA published the results of the second annual joint survey on the sales of non-exchange-traded investment products by licensed corporations and registered institutions. A total of 327 licensed corporations and 63 registered institutions reported data on the sale of investment products during 2021, with total transaction amounts reaching HKD 5,015 billion, and the number of participating investors increased by 5% to 770,000.

# September 27

The HKMA launched the "Compliance" module under the Enhanced Competency Framework (ECF), collaborating with the banking industry to develop a set of adoptable and transparent capability standards for professionals engaged in compliance functions, thereby enhancing the professional capabilities of practitioners in compliance roles.

# October 6

The HKMA, in collaboration with the HKAB, the banking and stored value facility sectors, supported the Hong Kong Police Force in launching the "Anti-Fraud Detection Tool" "Fraud Eye," to enhance prevention, detection, and mitigation of fraud in society and reduce public financial losses.

In addition to issuing practical guidance and updating the relevant "FAQs," the HKMA also collaborated with the banking and stored value facility sectors to raise public awareness of scam protection through consumer education information on websites and social media, and published an inSight article detailing this work.

# October 20

The HKMA, together with the Banking Sector SME Lending Coordination Mechanism, announced the extension of the "Pre-approved Interest-only Repayment" scheme by six months until the end of July 2023, and optimized certain partial principal repayment options to assist capable enterprises in preparing for gradual resumption of regular repayments.

HKMC Insurance Company Limited also announced that the interest-only repayment arrangement under the SME Financing Guarantee Scheme (SFGS) would extend the application period by six months until the end of June 2023, with the maximum period extended by six months to a total of 42 months.

# October 21

The HKMA issued two notices to update the requirements for the sale and distribution of loss-absorption products, and to provide guidance on suitability assessments.

# November 24

The HKMA, in collaboration with Cyberport with Deloitte's assistance, hosted the third Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulatory Technology Lab (AMLab 3). AMLab 3 built upon the achievements of previous AMLab series, utilizing network analytics to address fraud risks and mitigate losses from mule account networks.

# November 28

With strong support from the HKMA, the "Multiple Credit Reference Agencies" model-based Credit Reference Platform commenced operations, aiming to improve the service quality of credit reference agencies in Hong Kong and reduce operational risks arising from the current situation where only one commercial operator exists in the market.

# December 7

The HKMA issued a notice to banks regarding the upcoming implementation of the "Hong Kong Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing (Amendment) Bill 2022", which will come into effect in June 2023.

# December 15

The HKMA held a lecture on anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing (AML/CFT) for the banking and stored value facility sectors, covering updates on regulatory requirements, AML supervisory technology (Suptech) and regulatory technology (RegTech), requirements for monitoring sources of wealth, feedback on suspicious transaction reporting, and updates on counter-proliferation financing risk.

# December 23

The HKMA, IA, and the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority jointly issued a circular outlining the main findings and good practices observed from the first joint undercover inspection of intermediaries' sales techniques for two tax-deductible products (i.e., qualifying deferred annuity policies and mandatory provident fund tax-deductible voluntary contributions).

# December 31

All locally systemically important banks in Hong Kong had established a new layer of financial resources to absorb losses during resolution, marking a milestone for the HKMA in improving the viability of resolution for these banks and the resilience of the banking system.

# Hong Kong's Status as an International Financial Centre

# January 12

The HKMA published a discussion paper on cryptocurrency and stablecoins, outlining its thinking on the regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies, particularly stablecoins used for payments, and inviting the industry and public to provide comments on the proposed regulatory framework.

# January 27

The HKMA co-hosted the fifth Hong Kong-Swiss Financial Cooperation Dialogue with the Swiss Federal Department of Finance's Secretariat for International Financial Affairs via online platforms.

# February

The HKMA was reappointed as Chairperson of the Joint Working Group on Assessment and Compliance under the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) for a two-year term. FATF is the global standard-setting body for anti-money laundering.

# February 11

HKMC announced the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with 14 partner banks to establish a framework for infrastructure loans, setting out key principles for cooperation on infrastructure loans.

# February 14

The Hong Kong Institute of Monetary and Financial Research, part of the Hong Kong Institute, published a new applied research report titled "Demographic Changes and Long-Term Asset Markets: Opportunities and Developments in Hong Kong" (in English).

# March 8

An IMF delegation issued an assessment report on Hong Kong Special Administrative Region's Article IV consultation, reaffirming Hong Kong's status as a major international financial centre. It highlighted Hong Kong's robust and resilient financial system, effective macroeconomic and prudential policies, and sound regulatory and supervisory framework. The report also acknowledged the continued expansion and development of Hong Kong's financial industry during the pandemic.

The IMF also commended Hong Kong's significant progress in addressing climate change and recognized the government's ongoing efforts to strengthen the green and sustainable financial ecosystem.

# March 30

The Inter-Agency Green and Sustainable Finance Steering Group published a preliminary feasibility study on opportunities for Hong Kong's carbon market. Based on the study, the steering group announced follow-up actions supporting Hong Kong's development as a regional carbon trading center.

# April 12

The Hong Kong Institute for Monetary and Financial Research (HKIMR) and the Hong Kong Academy of Finance (AoF) co-hosted an online seminar on "Macroeconomic Developments, Fed Tightening, and Offshore RMB Market Development," attracting 840,000 online participants.

# April 27

The HKMA published a discussion paper titled "Looking at 'e-HKD' from a Policy and Design Perspective," outlining the main policy and design considerations involved in introducing a retail-level central bank digital currency ("e-HKD" or e-HKD) in Hong Kong, and seeking opinions.

# May 3

The HKMA and the World Bank Group member International Finance Corporation (IFC) jointly initiated the Green Banking Alliance, which partnered with Standard Chartered Bank to host an online roundtable on the transformation of green and sustainable capital markets.

# 2023年工作重點及前瞻

儘管香港經濟在2023 年初出現復甦跡象，但外圍環境仍然充滿挑戰及不確定性。近期美國和歐洲的銀行業受壓，個別美國本土銀行在2023 年3 月倒閉，對環球金融市場造成漣漪效應，而主要央行收緊貨幣政策，很有可能令2023 年全球經濟增長放緩甚或衰退。另一方面，地緣政治局勢緊張，以及去全球化的威脅持續，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。儘管如此，香港金融體系憑藉多年來所建立穩健的抗震能力及充裕的緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。

金管局非常重視保障貨幣及金融穩定。展望未來，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局會保持警惕，力求迅速辨識正浮現的風險，並靈活應對。與此同時，金管局會繼續把握機遇及創造政策空間，進一步提升香港作為主要國際金融中心的地位。面對充滿挑戰的投資環境，金管局在管理外匯基金時會繼續審慎投資，同時保持足夠靈活性，按需要採取防禦措施，並維持高流動性。

# 金融體系保持穩定健全

環球經濟前景仍受制於重大的不確定因素。金管局會密切注視最新發展，提高警覺，防範各種潛在風險，以維持金融體系穩定健全；這是關乎持續提供關鍵金融服務的先決條件，因此亦是維繫香港經濟正常運作的命脈。

# 對潛在風險保持警惕

在2023年，美國利率未來走勢的不確定性，以及在先進經濟體銀行體系出現的壓力，可能會對主要先進經濟體的增長前景帶來下行風險。此外，持續的地緣政治風險，可能會繼續拖累全球貿易，並會令環球金融市場不時出現波動。然而，香港金融體系憑藉過去多年所建立的抗震能力及緩衝，有足夠能力抵禦不利衝擊。金管局亦有能力、資源及決心維持香港貨幣及金融穩定。

金管局將繼續密切注視本地及外圍環境的風險與脆弱性，並會按需要採取適當措施維持香港的貨幣及金融體系穩定。金管局亦會研究對香港經濟有影響的事項，以及評估與這些事項相關的潛在風險。

# 保持銀行體系穩定

鑑於地緣政治緊張局勢升級，以及各主要央行大幅加息以遏抑通脹，預計2023年銀行業的經營環境仍然充滿挑戰。另一方面，科技發展迅速及數碼化對銀行業來說既有危又有機。面對瞬息萬變的金融環境，金管局致力透過持續的監管工作確保銀行具足夠能力抵禦衝擊。與此同時，金管局亦會參照國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 風險為本的監管重點

# 信用、流動性及市場風險

在2023年，金管局將繼續密切注視認可機構的資產質素，並聚焦於認可機構的貸款分類及撥備做法，以及對財務狀況較差的借款人的管理。金管局亦會加強其監察系統，並採取積極措施確保銀行體系的整體信用風險水平維持可控。

另一方面，金管局會繼續留意企業的營運環境，並與銀行業及商界保持緊密溝通，以就最終退出「預先批核還息不還本」計劃作好準備，並同時確保暫時面對困難的客戶仍然得到適切的信貸支援。

此外，面對不明朗的宏觀經濟環境，金管局於2023年亦會加強監管認可機構的流動性及市場風險管理。

# 業務操作及科技風險

隨着銀行在業務營運中更廣泛應用科技，金管局會致力提升銀行業的運作穩健性及網絡防衛能力。繼5月發出《監管政策手冊》新單元「運作穩健性」後，金管局會與業界保持緊密聯繫，審視認可機構在制定運作穩健性框架方面的進度。同時，金管局將透過跟進認可機構在「網絡防衛評估框架2.0」評估下發現的問題以及檢視認可機構實施穩固三重數據備份的進展，提高銀行業的網絡防衛能力。

隨着數碼化的步伐加快，金管局的其他監管重點包括加強對銀行的第三方服務供應商風險管理的監管，以及提升銀行業的數據管治能力。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集

在2023年，金管局的工作重點包括更新監管資訊、加強打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（反洗錢）生態系統各持份者的合作以應對洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（洗錢）風險，以及進一步推動反洗錢監管科技與合規科技的發展。金管局的《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集指引》亦會作出修訂，並會就「政治人物」採取與風險相稱的措施發出具體指引，從而促進業界以有效及風險為本的方法落實法例的主要修訂。與此同時，金管局會擴大現有公私營夥伴合作的涵蓋範圍以加強訊息共享，以及支持推出銀行之間的訊息共享平台，藉以加快偵測可疑戶口及防範戶口被濫用，並加強對騙案受害人的保障和協助受害人追討損失。金管局亦會透過「反洗錢合規科技實驗室」及其他反洗錢合規科技項目，進一步集中推動採用合規科技（包括數據分析），並致力發展宏觀分析能力，以配合其數據為本的反洗錢監管工作。透過實施上述各項措施，金管局將能更迅速針對傀儡戶口網絡等系統性洗錢風險採取相應措施，以及靈活應對不斷轉變的威脅。

# 財富管理業務

金管局在2023年會加強有關認可機構在財富管理以及銷售證券、強制性公積金（強積金）與其他投資及保險產品方面的操守的現場審查及非現場監察。2023年的重點將會是「跨境理財通」計劃、數碼分銷及諮詢平台、虛擬資產、環境、社會及管治(ESG)投資產品及長期保險產品。金管局在有關過程中會參考市場最新發展及國際標準的修訂。

金管局亦會與其他監管機構及銀行界緊密聯繫，並按需要就銷售投資、保險及強積金產品的監管標準向認可機構提供指引，其中亦會包括有關提供虛擬資產相關投資服務的指引。就此而言，為促進虛擬資產行業可持續及負責任地發展，金管局會積極參與相關國際組織，並與政府及其他金融監管機構合作，制定全面的虛擬資產監管架構。

隨着「跨境理財通」順利推出，金管局會與業界及相關監管機構聯繫，以優化該計劃。此外，金管局亦會與證券及期貨事務監察委員會（證監會）及業界合作，精簡投資產品銷售程序（包括適用於資深投資者的銷售程序），以及開始根據相關《監管政策手冊》新單元及新營運守則監管認可機構的信託業務。

# 監察金融市場基建

金管局的目標是按照《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》（《支付條例》）、《金融市場基建的原則》（《基建原則》），以及支付及金融基建委員會發出的各項指引促進其所監察的金融市場基建的安全及效率，按需要參照最新的國際標準評估各項基建。金管局會參與支付及金融基建委員會與國際證監會組織對實施《基建原則》的監察及評估計劃，亦會參與國際標準制定組織的工作，並參照國際慣例或因應市場及科技發展加強本身的監察規定。同時，如有需要，金管局會與有關當局合作，進一步加強合作監察安排。

# 制定政策

金管局會因應國際標準及最佳做法，繼續加強及優化銀行監管架構與政策。

# 在香港實施巴塞爾標準

# 資本標準

金管局會透過實施巴塞爾銀行監管委員會（巴塞爾委員會）近年發布的標準，進一步優化資本框架，當中包括：
- 2017年12月《巴塞爾協定三：危機後改革的最終方案》、2019年1月（2019年2月修訂）《市場風險最低資本規定》，以及2020年7月《信用估值調整風險架構具針對性的修訂》所載的經修訂資本標準 — 上述經修訂資本標準統稱《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案，載明信用風險、市場風險、信用估值調整風險及業務操作風險的新監管處理方法，並引入出項下限規定，以及優化槓桿比率框架。經過2022年的多輪業界諮詢後，金管局計劃在2023年就《銀行業（資本）規則》（《資本規則》）的建議修訂進行法定諮詢，以實施上述各項規定及正值中性逆周期緩衝資本。有關修訂預計於同年內提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序，並不早於2024年1月1日生效，作為最低要求。
- 2022年12月《加密資產風險承擔的審慎處理方法》金管局計劃按照巴塞爾委員會的時間表，在2025年1月1日於本地實施有關標準，並打算於2023年就相關建議諮詢業界。

# 風險承擔限度

金管局於2023年3月就《銀行業（風險承擔限度）規則》的建議修訂諮詢業界。有關建議修訂主要是因應金管局實施上文提及的《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案下的經修訂資本標準而提出。諮詢文件亦包括就《資本規則》下有關官方實體集中風險的處理方法所作出的其他相應修訂。經修訂規則的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 流動性標準

金管局擬於2023年諮詢業界有關透過《2023年銀行業（流動性）（修訂）規則》（《2023年流動性修訂規則》）對《銀行業（流動性）規則》作出的建議修訂。相關修訂是因應同時期的《資本規則》建議修訂而作出，所以《2023年流動性修訂規則》的目標實施日期將與落實《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案的經修訂《資本規則》中的信用風險部分的實施日期一致（即不早於2024年1月1日）。

# 披露標準

《巴塞爾協定三》最終改革方案中與經修訂資本標準相關的新的及經修訂的披露規定，主要載於巴塞爾委員會分別於2018年12月及2021年11月發出的《第三支柱1 披露規定 — 更新框架》及《修訂市場風險披露規定》。巴塞爾委員會亦於2019年6月發出《修訂槓桿比率披露規定》，藉修訂槓桿比率的披露規定處理對潛在「粉飾櫥窗」（指銀行在報告日期前後減少某些交易的交易量，從而人為地提高報告及公開披露的槓桿比率）的關注。為在香港實施上述新的及經修訂的披露規定，金管局亦正擬備《銀行業（披露）規則》（《披露規則》）的相應修訂，以及經修訂後的標準披露模版及表格，並在過程中徵詢業界意見。預計《披露規則》的修訂將於2023年內連同《資本規則》的修訂一併提交立法會進行先訂立後審議程序。

# 2023 Work Priorities and Outlook

Although Hong Kong's economy showed signs of recovery at the beginning of 2023, the external environment remained challenging and uncertain. Recent pressures in the banking sectors of the United States and Europe, including the collapse of some U.S. domestic banks in March 2023, had ripple effects on global financial markets. Tightening monetary policies by major central banks could likely lead to slower global economic growth or even recession in 2023. Meanwhile, ongoing geopolitical tensions and the threat of de-globalization may continue to hinder global trade and cause fluctuations in global financial markets. Despite this, Hong Kong's financial system, backed by years of building up robust resilience and sufficient buffers, has the capacity to withstand adverse shocks.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) places great emphasis on safeguarding monetary and financial stability. Looking ahead, facing an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will remain vigilant, striving to swiftly identify emerging risks and respond flexibly. At the same time, the HKMA will continue to seize opportunities and create policy space to further enhance Hong Kong's position as a major international financial center. In the face of a challenging investment environment, the HKMA will maintain prudent investment practices when managing the Exchange Fund (EF), while retaining sufficient flexibility to take defensive measures as needed and maintaining high liquidity.

# Maintaining a Stable and Sound Financial System

Global economic prospects remain constrained by significant uncertainties. The HKMA will closely monitor developments, stay alert, and prevent various potential risks to maintain a stable and sound financial system; this is a prerequisite for continuously providing critical financial services, and therefore also vital for maintaining the normal operation of Hong Kong's economy.

# Staying Vigilant Against Potential Risks

In 2023, uncertainty regarding future trends in U.S. interest rates, along with pressures in the banking systems of advanced economies, may pose downside risks to growth prospects in those economies. Additionally, persistent geopolitical risks may continue to hinder global trade and cause periodic volatility in global financial markets. However, Hong Kong's financial system, supported by its resilience and buffers built over many years, has the capability to withstand adverse shocks. The HKMA also has the ability, resources, and determination to maintain Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability.

The HKMA will continue to closely monitor risks and vulnerabilities in both the local and external environments, and take appropriate measures as needed to maintain the stability of Hong Kong's monetary and financial system. The HKMA will also examine matters affecting Hong Kong's economy and assess related potential risks.

# Maintaining Banking System Stability

Given the escalation of geopolitical tensions and the significant interest rate hikes by major central banks to curb inflation, it is expected that the operating environment for the banking sector in 2023 will remain challenging. On the other hand, rapid technological development and digitalization present both challenges and opportunities for the banking industry. Facing the ever-changing financial landscape, the HKMA is committed to ensuring through continuous regulatory efforts that banks have sufficient capabilities to withstand shocks. At the same time, the HKMA will refer to international standards and best practices to continue strengthening and optimizing the banking regulatory framework and policies.

# Risk-Based Supervisory Focus

# Credit, Liquidity, and Market Risks

In 2023, the HKMA will continue to closely monitor the asset quality of authorized institutions (AIs) and focus on their loan classification and provisioning practices, as well as the management of vulnerable borrowers. The HKMA will also strengthen its surveillance system and take proactive measures to ensure that the overall credit risk level of the banking system remains manageable.

Meanwhile, the HKMA will continue to monitor the business environment of enterprises and maintain close communication with the banking sector and the business community to prepare for the eventual exit from the "Pre-approved Interest-only Payment" scheme, while ensuring that customers temporarily facing difficulties still receive appropriate credit support.

Additionally, in the face of an uncertain macroeconomic environment, the HKMA will also enhance the regulation of liquidity and market risk management of AIs in 2023.

# Operational and Technology Risks

As banks increasingly apply technology in their operations, the HKMA will strive to improve the operational resilience and cyber resilience of the banking sector. Following the release of the new unit in the Supervisory Policy Manual (SPM) titled "Operational Resilience," the HKMA will maintain close contact with the industry to review the progress of AIs in developing their operational resilience framework. At the same time, the HKMA will enhance the cyber resilience of the banking sector by following up on issues identified under the Cyber Resilience Assessment Framework 2.0 and reviewing the progress of AIs implementing tertiary data backup arrangements.

With the acceleration of digitalization, other supervisory priorities of the HKMA include enhancing the regulation of third-party risk management and improving the data governance capabilities of the banking sector.

# Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism

In 2023, the HKMA's work priorities include updating regulatory information, strengthening collaboration among stakeholders in the anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing (AML/CFT) ecosystem to address money laundering and terrorist financing (ML/TF) risks, and further promoting the development of AML/CFT regulatory technology (RegTech). The HKMA's "Guidelines on Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Financing of Terrorism" will also be revised, and specific guidance will be issued regarding appropriate measures for politically exposed persons (PEPs) to promote the effective implementation of legislative amendments using a risk-based approach. At the same time, the HKMA will expand the scope of existing public-private partnerships to enhance information sharing, and support the launch of a bank-to-bank information sharing platform to accelerate the detection of suspicious accounts and prevent account misuse, while strengthening protection for victims of fraud and assisting them in recovering losses. The HKMA will also further promote the adoption of RegTech (including data analytics) through the "AML Compliance Tech Lab" and other AML compliance tech initiatives, and strive to develop macro-level analytical capabilities to support its data-driven AML supervision. Through the implementation of these measures, the HKMA will be able to more quickly address systemic money laundering risks such as mule account networks and flexibly respond to evolving threats.

# Wealth Management Activities

In 2023, the HKMA will intensify on-site examinations and offsite reviews of AIs' conduct in wealth management and the sale of securities, mandatory provident fund (MPF) products, and other investment and insurance products. The key focuses for 2023 will be the Cross-border Wealth Management Connect initiative, digital distribution and advisory platforms, virtual assets, environmental, social, and governance (ESG) investment products, and long-term insurance products. The HKMA will reference the latest market developments and revisions to international standards during this process.

The HKMA will also maintain close coordination with other regulators and the banking sector, and provide guidance to AIs on regulatory standards for the sale of investment, insurance, and MPF products, including guidance on offering virtual asset-related investment services. In this regard, to promote the sustainable and responsible development of the virtual asset industry, the HKMA will actively participate in relevant international organizations and collaborate with the government and other financial regulators to establish a comprehensive regulatory framework for virtual assets.

With the successful launch of the Cross-border Wealth Management Connect initiative, the HKMA will maintain close contact with the industry and relevant regulators to optimize the program. Furthermore, the HKMA will cooperate with the Securities and Futures Commission (SFC) and the industry to streamline the sales procedures for investment products (including procedures applicable to qualified investors), and begin regulating AIs' trust activities according to the new units in the Supervisory Policy Manual and new operational codes.

# Monitoring Financial Market Infrastructures

The HKMA aims to promote the safety and efficiency of the financial market infrastructures it oversees in accordance with the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Payment Ordinance), the Principles for Financial Market Infrastructures (Infrastructure Principles), and the guidelines issued by the Payments and Financial Infrastructure Committee. It will assess the infrastructures against the latest international standards and update its supervisory provisions accordingly. The HKMA will participate in the monitoring and evaluation programs of the Committee on Payments and Market Infrastructures (CPMI) and the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) for the implementation of the Infrastructure Principles. It will also engage with standard-setting bodies and update its supervisory rules based on international practices or in response to market and technological developments. Where necessary, the HKMA will cooperate with relevant authorities to further strengthen collaborative supervisory arrangements.

# Developing Policies

The HKMA will continue to strengthen and optimize the banking regulatory framework and policies in line with international standards and best practices.

# Implementing Basel Standards in Hong Kong

# Capital Standards

The HKMA will further refine the capital framework by implementing the standards recently issued by the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (BCBS), including:
- The Finalisation of the Basel III: Post-crisis reforms published in December 2017, the Minimum Capital Requirements for Market Risk issued in January 2019 (revised in February 2019), and the Targeted Revisions to the Credit Valuation Adjustment Risk Framework published in July 2020 – collectively referred to as the Finalising Post-crisis Reforms under Basel III, which outline new regulatory approaches for credit risk, market risk, credit valuation adjustment risk, and operational risk, introduce floor requirements, and optimize the leverage ratio framework. After multiple rounds of consultations with the industry in 2022, the HKMA plans to conduct a statutory consultation on proposed revisions to the Banking (Capital) Rules (Capital Rules) in 2023 to implement these provisions and the countercyclical capital buffer at a neutral level. These revisions are expected to be submitted to the Legislative Council for the 'legislative before scrutiny' procedure within the same year and will not come into effect earlier than 1 January 2024 as minimum requirements.
- The Prudent Treatment of Crypto Asset Risk Exposure issued by the BCBS in December 2022. The HKMA plans to implement these standards locally by 1 January 2025 in line with the BCBS schedule and intends to consult the industry on related proposals in 2023.

# Exposure Limits

The HKMA consulted the industry in March 2023 on proposed revisions to the Banking (Exposure Limits) Rules. These proposed revisions mainly stem from the implementation of the revised capital standards under the final post-crisis reforms of Basel III mentioned above. The consultation paper also includes other corresponding revisions to the handling of concentrated risk exposure to official entities under the Capital Rules. The targeted implementation date for the revised rules will align with the implementation date of the credit risk portion of the revised Capital Rules under the final post-crisis reforms of Basel III (i.e., no earlier than 1 January 2024).

# Liquidity Standards

The HKMA plans to consult the industry in 2023 on proposed revisions to the Banking (Liquidity) (Amendment) Rules 2023 (BLAR 2023), which aim to revise the Banking (Liquidity) Rules. These revisions are made in conjunction with the simultaneous implementation of the proposed revisions to the Capital Rules. Therefore, the targeted implementation date for BLAR 2023 will align with the implementation date of the credit risk portion of the revised Capital Rules under the final post-crisis reforms of Basel III (i.e., no earlier than 1 January 2024).

# Disclosure Standards

The new and revised disclosure requirements related to the revised capital standards under the Finalising Post-crisis Reforms under Basel III are primarily outlined in the "Principle 3 Disclosures - Updated Framework" issued by the BCBS in December 2018 and the "Revised Market Risk Disclosures" issued in November 2021. The BCBS also issued the "Revised Leverage Ratio Disclosures" in June 2019 to address concerns about potential "window dressing" (referring to banks reducing certain transactions before and after reporting dates to artificially inflate reported and publicly disclosed leverage ratios). To implement these new and revised disclosure requirements in Hong Kong, the HKMA is preparing corresponding revisions to the Banking (Disclosures) Rules (Disclosure Rules) as well as revised standard disclosure templates and forms, and seeking industry feedback during the process. It is expected that the revisions to the Disclosure Rules will be submitted to the Legislative Council for the 'legislative before scrutiny' procedure together with the revisions to the Capital Rules within 2023.

# 機構管治

金管局作為香港的中央銀行機構，深明良好的管治對維持及維護公眾對金管局履行其法定職責的信任及信心的重要性，因此一直致力秉持高水平的機構管治。

為實踐良好機構管治的承諾，金管局：
- 建立了一套清晰且具備高問責性的機構管治架構；
- 實施完善穩健的監控措施以管理風險，並確保所有職級員工的行為及其日常運作均符合指定標準；及
- 奉行具透明度及保持開放的政策，與各持份者保持緊密聯繫。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府（特區政府）架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作；
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場；
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜；
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率；及
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信任。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理備受社會關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。尤其，金管局透過傳統及社交媒體適時澄清有關金管局政策的失實資訊及謠言。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；及
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、監管資源、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有大量金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。有關金管局與公眾溝通及聯繫的工作，詳見「機構職能」一章（第157至162頁）。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表不時出席立法會事務委員會及小組委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 監控措施

金管局採用穩健有效的內部及外部監控機制，確保秉持高水平的員工操守、審慎的風險管理，以及適當的制衡。內部及外部審計職能就監控機制是否足夠及具成效提供獨立評估。

# 行為守則

《行為守則》就員工的道德與法律責任提供指引，確保所有職級員工的行為均符合指定標準。

# 內部監控

# 運作監控

作為風險管理的第一度防線，所有部門及分處均有責任評估其工作流程的風險，並制定適當的監控措施，確保金管局日常運作穩妥。

# 機構風險管理

風險管理亦在機構層面進行。由金管局總裁擔任主席的風險委員會，是機構風險管理架構的基石之一。

風險委員會審視和商討各部門所識別的潛在及新生風險，以及相關監控措施和緩解策略是否充足，並由該會定出適當的跟進行動。

# 內部審計

金管局內部審核處獨立評估不同部門的管治程序、風險管理及監控措施是否足夠及具成效，並提出改善建議。

# 外部審計

根據《外匯基金條例》第7條，外匯基金的財務報表由香港特區政府審計署審核。審計署並無就此項服務收取費用。經審核的外匯基金財務報表刊載於金管局《年報》。

# Corporate Governance

As the central banking institution of Hong Kong, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) recognizes the importance of sound governance in maintaining and reinforcing public confidence in its performance of statutory duties. Therefore, it has been committed to upholding high standards of corporate governance.

To fulfill its commitment to good corporate governance, the HKMA:
- Established a clear and highly accountable governance framework;
- Implemented robust monitoring mechanisms to manage risks and ensure that the conduct and daily operations of employees at all levels meet specified standards; and
- Maintained transparent policies and maintained close communication with stakeholders.

# HKMA and the HKSAR Government

The HKMA is part of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (HKSAR) government structure but can employ staff under different employment conditions from civil servants to attract individuals with appropriate experience and expertise. The Chief Executive of the HKMA and its staff are public officers. The HKMA operates with a high degree of autonomy within the scope of the statutory powers delegated or transferred to the Monetary Authority by the Financial Secretary.

The Financial Secretary is responsible for determining Hong Kong's monetary policy objectives and monetary system. In a letter dated 25 June 2003 addressed to the Monetary Authority, the Financial Secretary stated that monetary stability should be maintained through the Currency Board arrangements, keeping the exchange value of the Hong Dollar (HKD) at approximately 7.80 HKD to 1 US dollar. The Monetary Authority is independently responsible for achieving monetary policy objectives, including deciding on relevant strategies, tools, and operational means, and is responsible for maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's monetary system.

With the assistance of the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, the Financial Secretary is responsible for maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's financial system and the policy to maintain Hong Kong's status as an international financial centre. To implement these policies, the responsibilities of the Monetary Authority include:
- Promoting the overall stability and effective operation of the banking system;
- Cooperating with other relevant authorities and organizations to develop the debt market;
- Handling matters relating to the issuance and circulation of legal tender notes and coins;
- Promoting the safety and efficiency of financial infrastructure through the development of payment, clearing and settlement systems, and operating these systems when appropriate; and
- Cooperating with other relevant authorities and organizations to promote confidence in Hong Kong's currency and financial system, and implementing appropriate market development initiatives to enhance Hong Kong's competitiveness in financial services.

The Exchange Fund is under the control of the Financial Secretary. The Monetary Authority is responsible to the Financial Secretary for the utilization and investment management of the Exchange Fund based on the delegated authority.

# Accountability and Transparency

In carrying out its day-to-day operations and implementing government policy objectives, the HKMA maintains a high level of autonomy, accompanied by strong accountability and transparency.

The HKMA is committed to promoting monetary and banking system stability, effectively managing official reserves, developing and supervising a sound and diversified financial infrastructure, thereby strengthening Hong Kong's position as an international financial centre and driving Hong Kong's economic development.

For the HKMA to effectively fulfill its responsibilities, it must gain the trust of the public. Therefore, the HKMA takes its responsibility to explain its policies and work to the public seriously, and strives to address issues that have attracted social attention within its jurisdiction. In particular, the HKMA uses traditional and social media channels to promptly clarify misleading information and rumors regarding its policies.

The Chief Executive of the HKMA is appointed by the Financial Secretary, so the HKMA is accountable to the public through the Financial Secretary. As the HKMA's authority is defined by legislation passed by the Legislative Council, it is also accountable to the public through the Legislative Council. The HKMA also understands its broader responsibility to promote public awareness of its role and objectives, and to closely monitor issues of concern to the public. While performing its daily tasks and maintaining wide-ranging contact with society, the HKMA adheres to a policy of maximizing transparency and openness. This policy has two main objectives:
- To make the financial sector and the public fully aware of the HKMA's work, to the greatest extent possible, while taking into account market sensitivity, commercial confidentiality, and statutory restrictions on disclosure of confidential information; and
- To ensure that the HKMA remains attuned to public sentiment and provides appropriate responses to public opinion.

The HKMA is committed to achieving the highest international standards in transparency. In addition to maintaining extensive contacts with the media, the HKMA publishes various regular and special publications in both Chinese and English. The HKMA's bilingual website (www.hkma.gov.hk) includes dedicated sections featuring economic research, statistical data, regulatory resources, consumer information, and other topics. It also features a large number of publications, press releases, speeches, and presentation materials issued by the HKMA. Furthermore, the HKMA utilizes social media platforms to communicate more effectively with the public in the digital age. The HKMA has an information center with library and exhibition areas open to the public six days a week. Details of the HKMA's communication and engagement activities with the public are outlined in the "Corporate Functions" chapter (pages 157 to 162).

The frequency with which the HKMA discloses information on the Exchange Fund and Currency Board accounts has gradually increased, with the content becoming increasingly detailed. Since 1999, the HKMA has participated in the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Special Data Dissemination Standard (SDDS) program for central banks. The HKMA also publishes meeting records of the Currency Board Sub-Committee of the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee (EFAC), as well as the Currency Board Arrangements Operating Report. Since 1996, the HKMA's website has featured banking regulatory policies and guidelines.

The relationship between the HKMA and the Legislative Council is crucial for enhancing accountability and transparency. The Chief Executive of the HKMA has committed to briefing the Panel on Financial Affairs of the Legislative Council three times annually on the HKMA's work and policies, and answering related inquiries. Additionally, HKMA representatives regularly attend committee meetings and sub-committee sessions of the Legislative Council to explain and discuss specific matters, and assist Members in reviewing draft bills.

# Monitoring Mechanisms

The HKMA employs robust and effective internal and external monitoring mechanisms to ensure adherence to high standards of employee conduct, prudent risk management, and appropriate controls. The internal and external audit functions provide independent assessments of whether the monitoring mechanisms are adequate and effective.

# Code of Conduct

The Code of Conduct provides guidance on the ethical and legal responsibilities of employees, ensuring that the behavior of employees at all levels meets specified standards.

# Internal Controls

# Operational Controls

As the first line of defence, all departments and divisions are responsible for assessing the risks associated with their operational processes and establishing appropriate controls to ensure the smooth operation of the HKMA.

# Organisational Risk Management

Risk management is also conducted at the entity level. The Risk Committee, chaired by the Chief Executive of the HKMA, is one of the key components of the organisational risk management framework.

The Risk Committee reviews and discusses potential and emerging risks identified by various departments, as well as the adequacy of related controls and mitigating strategies, and determines appropriate follow-up actions.

# Internal Audit

The Internal Audit Division conducts independent evaluations of the effectiveness and sufficiency of governance procedures, risk management, and controls across different departments, and makes recommendations for improvement.

# External Audit

Under Section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the financial statements of the Exchange Fund are audited by the Office of the Auditor General of the HKSAR. No fees are charged for this service. Audited financial statements of the Exchange Fund are published in the HKMA Annual Report.

# 經濟及金融環境

面對第五波新冠病毒疫情、金融狀況收緊及充滿挑戰的外圍環境，香港經濟在2022年顯著收縮。勞工市場持續一段時間轉差，其後逐步改善，而通脹則維持溫和。資產市場亦有所受壓。受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預計2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。

# 經濟回顧

# 實體經濟活動

受本地及外圍環境各項不利因素拖累，香港經濟在2022年收縮3.5%（表1及圖1）。本地方面，由於香港爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情，私人消費在第1季急跌，其後受惠於社交距離措施逐步放寬及政府消費券計劃的刺激，私人消費再度錄得按季增長。在營商氣氛疲弱及金融狀況收緊下，整體投資支出較2021年顯著下跌。對外方面，隨着外部需求轉弱，加上內地與香港之間的跨境陸路貨運受阻，香港貨物出口下挫。服務輸出依然大致疲弱，部分反映訪港旅遊活動低迷，但其後隨着政府於9月下旬撤銷抵港強制檢疫要求，情況於第4季稍為改善。

圖1 組成部分對實質本地生產總值增長的貢獻
資料來源：政府統計處

表 1 按開支項目計的實質本地生產總值增長（比對上期）
註：經季節性調整的本地固定資本形成總額按季增減幅度不詳。
資料來源：政府統計處

# 通脹

本地通脹壓力於2022年稍升，但仍屬溫和。具體而言，按年基本通脹率逐步上升至12月2%的溫和水平，其中外圍能源及食品價格高企的影響部分被溫和的本地成本壓力所抵銷，尤其是偏軟的房屋租金（圖2）。此外，在經濟活動疲弱下，名義工資增長及商業樓宇租金持續偏軟，亦有助遏抑通脹。2022年全年合計，基本及整體通脹率分別為1.7%及1.9%。

# 勞工市場

疫情下勞工市場狀況在2022年初急速惡化，但隨後持續改善。失業率在4月升至5.4%的高位後，於12月顯著回落至3.5%（圖3），當中大多數行業的失業率均有所下降。總就業人數（圖3）及私營機構職位空缺回升，反映整體勞工需求逐步回復，惟總就業人數仍低於疫情前水平。名義工資和勞工收入的按年升幅亦略為加快。另一方面，與去年同期比較，勞動人口於12月略為減少1.5%，部分原因是勞動人口參與率輕微下跌。

圖2 基本消費物價通脹
資料來源：政府統計處及金管局職員估計數字

圖3 勞工市場狀況
資料來源：政府統計處

# 股市

本港股市在2022年出現大幅波動。承接2021年的下行趨勢，恒生指數加速下跌，在2022年10月31日收報14,687點，是自2009年以來的最低水平（圖4）。股市顯著調整，最初是由市場對本地新冠病毒疫情、美國加息及俄烏局勢的憂慮加劇所觸發，其後由於環球金融狀況收緊及內地新冠病毒疫情導致環球經濟前景轉差，令股市調整幅度進一步擴大。股市在年內最後兩個月重拾一些上升動力，部分受到內地優化防疫抗疫措施所支持。恒生指數於年底收報19,781點，較2021年底顯著下跌15.5%，連續第三年下挫。

# 物業市場

在金融狀況收緊及經濟活動疲弱下，住宅物業市場亦有所受壓。樓價於2022年回落15%（圖4），成交量也大幅縮減39%至45,050宗，創下有紀錄以來的新低。儘管樓價下跌，置業負擔能力仍然偏緊。實際按揭利率於年內由約1.6厘上升至3.375至3.625厘，增加供樓人士的按揭供款負擔。非住宅物業市場亦進一步回軟。在空置率高企下，其價格有所回落，租金亦維持偏軟。

圖4 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

受惠於內地與香港全面通關，預期2023年香港經濟增長將由低位復甦。儘管先進經濟體增長預期放緩將繼續拖累香港貨物出口，但內地經濟復甦及跨境陸路貨運限制撤銷，應能為本港經濟提供支持。內地與香港全面通關亦有望令香港入境旅遊及其他服務輸出顯著受惠，並提振本地營商氣氛及資本開支。私人消費亦將會在勞工市場轉強下進一步改善。政府預測2023年全年實質本地生產總值會顯著增長，介乎3.5至5.5%。然而，香港經濟增長前景仍受眾多風險及不明朗因素所影響，並很大程度上取決於美國聯邦儲備局政策利率走勢、全球增長前景、地緣政治局勢持續緊張以及本地入境旅遊的復甦步伐。

# 通脹及勞工市場

展望未來，預期本地通脹將輕微上升，但在各種因素互相抵銷下應保持溫和。儘管外圍價格應會維持高企，但由於部分主要經濟體的經濟活動轉弱及商品價格上行壓力緩和，外圍價格的上升動力或會進一步減弱。同樣地，隨着本地經濟復甦及勞工市場改善，本地成本壓力或會輕微上升，但房屋租金偏軟應繼續在一定程度上抵銷其影響。政府預測2023年全年合計的整體及基本通脹率分別為2.9%及2.5%。另一方面，勞工市場狀況有望隨着本地經濟活動復常而進一步改善。

# 銀行體系表現

香港銀行體系在2022年面對充滿挑戰的宏觀經濟環境，包括年初爆發第五波新冠病毒疫情、地緣政治局勢升溫，以及全球各大央行大幅度加息應對通脹上升等。面對各項挑戰，香港銀行應付裕如，資本及流動性狀況繼續保持充裕。年內銀行體系面對的信貸風險增加，但整體資產質素維持於健康水平。與此同時，利率上升促使銀行淨利息收入增加，但其正面影響因呆壞帳準備金增加及費用與佣金收入減少而被局部抵銷。整體而言，零售銀行盈利較2021年改善。

# 資產質素

銀行體系的特定分類貸款比率由2021年底的0.89%上升至2022年底的1.38%，逾期及經重組貸款比率於同期由0.56%升至0.85%（圖5）。中國內地相關貸款的特定分類貸款比率於2022年底為2.21%，亦較2021年底的0.89%上升。特定分類貸款比率上升，主要是由於部分內地房地產發展商的貸款評級被下調。儘管如此，銀行撥備充足，截至2022年底，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率（即信貸撥備和特定分類貸款比率）約維持於80%。若將抵押品變現價值從呆壞帳餘額中扣除，銀行信貸撥備覆蓋率約140%。另一方面，2022年底住宅按揭貸款及信用卡貸款的拖欠比率仍然處於低位，分別為0.06%及0.23%（圖6）。

圖5 銀行體系的資產質素
註：數字涵蓋香港辦事處、境外分行及境外主要附屬公司。
資料來源：金管局

圖6 住宅按揭貸款及信用卡貸款的拖欠比率
資料來源：金管局

# 盈利走勢

銀行體系在2022年繼續錄得盈利。年內零售銀行的整體除稅前經營溢利上升19.0%（圖7）。盈利改善是受惠於淨利息收入（+34%）及外匯與衍生工具收入增加（+72%），但部分升幅被呆壞帳準備金增加（+151%）及費用與佣金收入減少（–19%）所抵銷。在加息環境下，淨息差由上一年的0.98%擴闊至2022年的1.31%（圖8）。年內市場波動增加，亦令銀行來自外匯及衍生工具業務的收入增加。呆壞帳準備金增加是由於須為新的特定分類貸款預留特殊準備金，而在金融市場表現疲弱下，費用及佣金收入減少。零售銀行成本與收入比率由2021年的54.7%，降至2022年的48.0%（圖9）。

# 資產負債表走勢

2022年銀行體系資產負債表擴大2.5%。資產上升是由於外匯及衍生工具持倉按市價計值增加。面對外圍不明朗因素及利率趨升，年內貸款需求減弱。相比2021年錄得3.8%的增幅，2022年貸款總額減少3.0%。其中在香港境外使用的貸款減少10.2%，貿易融資減少13.5%，在香港使用的貸款則稍增0.9%。中國內地相關貸款繼2021年增長3.7%後，於2022年減少4.4%。

在資產負債表的負債方面，銀行體系存款繼續錄得溫和增長。存款總額於2022年增加1.7%，相比2021年的增幅為4.6%。由於貸款總額減少而存款總額增加，整體貸存比率由2021年底的71.8%稍降至2022年底的68.5%（圖10）。

# 資本充足水平

銀行在2022年的資本狀況維持充裕。2022年底本地註冊認可機構的綜合總資本比率為20.1%，相比上一年為20.2%；一級資本比率為18.1%（圖11）。兩者均遠高於相關國際最低要求。《巴塞爾協定三》槓桿比率於2022年底為7.9%（圖12）。

# 流動性狀況

銀行體系的流動性狀況繼續維持穩健，成為在宏觀經濟環境不明朗因素加劇下的重要支柱。第1類機構的季度平均流動性覆蓋比率在2022年第4季為162.3%，第2類機構的季度平均流動性維持比率為63.2%（圖13）。銀行體系的主要資金來源仍然是客戶存款。於2022年底，第1類機構的穩定資金淨額比率及第2A類機構的核心資金比率分別為137.7%及155.7%（圖14）。以上所有4個比率均遠高於法定最低要求。

# Economic and Financial Environment

Faced with the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic, tighter financial conditions, and a challenging external environment, Hong Kong's economy contracted significantly in 2022. The labor market deteriorated for a prolonged period before gradually improving, while inflation remained moderate. Asset markets also experienced pressure. With the full resumption of border crossings between the Mainland and Hong Kong, it is expected that Hong Kong's economy will recover from its low base in 2023.

# Economic Review

# Real Economic Activities

Hong Kong's economy contracted by 3.5% in 2022 due to various adverse factors in both the local and external environments (Table 1 and Figure 1). Locally, the outbreak of the fifth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic caused private consumption to fall sharply in the first quarter, but later rebounded with the gradual easing of social distancing measures and the stimulus effect of the government's consumer vouchers scheme. Under weak business sentiment and tightened financial conditions, total investment expenditure declined significantly compared to 2021. Externally, with weakening demand and disruptions in cross-border truck movements between the Mainland and Hong Kong, Hong Kong's exports of goods fell. Service exports remained broadly weak, partly reflecting the sluggish inbound tourism activities, although this improved slightly in the fourth quarter following the government's removal of compulsory quarantine requirements in late September.
