# Corporate Functions

The corporate functions departments support the operations of the HKMA, maintaining high transparency and accountability, and demonstrating excellent efficiency and professionalism. To enhance public understanding of the HKMA's policies and work, the HKMA maintains effective communication with the broader society and markets through traditional media, social media, websites, information centers, and other channels.

Internally, the HKMA has carefully built a workforce emphasizing flexibility and sustainable development, while adhering to strict financial discipline and enhancing information technology capabilities to respond to changes and ensure the effective implementation of various policies and measures.

# Maintaining Transparency

# Media Relations and Social Media

The HKMA maintains close contact with the media to increase transparency and enhance public understanding of its policies and operations. In 2022, the HKMA held or participated in 112 physical and online events, including eight press conferences, 11 stand-up interviews, and 93 other public activities. The HKMA also arranged 46 media interviews. Throughout the year, 492 bilingual press releases were issued, and numerous media inquiries were handled daily.

To enhance public awareness of the HKMA's core functions, the HKMA organized press conferences and media briefings for local, mainland China, and overseas media, covering topics such as Currency Board operations, green and sustainable finance, and Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs).

Media outlets actively participated in the HKMA's events in 2022, including the Global Financial Leaders' Investment Summit. This three-day event attracted significant media attention, with over 200 journalists from 87 media organizations attending, resulting in approximately 1,000 news articles published in local, regional, and international media. Additionally, the event arranged live streaming for 30 media outlets.

To effectively engage the public, the HKMA operates six social media pages (including Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, WeChat, and YouTube), with over 100,000 followers. In 2022, the HKMA launched a WeChat page to reach a wider audience. The HKMA uses social media to promote major events and initiatives, including the Global Financial Leaders' Investment Summit and the Government Green Bond Programme, and to raise public awareness of multiple areas, including the Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS), financial technology, and scam protection.

Chief Executive of HKMA Mr Eddie Yue interviewed by media during the Global Financial Leaders' Investment Summit

Deputy Chief Executive of HKMA Mr Eddie Yue delivered opening keynote speech at Hong Kong FinTech Week 2022

Deputy Chief Executive of HKMA Mr Arthur Yuen spoke at the Accenture-hosted FinTech Elite Forum 2022

Deputy Chief Executive of HKMA Mr Howard Lee hosted a press conference explaining the HKMA's policy stance on e-HKD

Deputy Chief Executive of HKMA Mr Darryl Chan delivered a video address at the Annual Conference of the Financial Street Forum

# Public Enquiries

The Public Enquiry Service is an effective channel for enhancing public understanding of the HKMA's core functions and operations. In 2022, it handled 9,952 enquiries. Approximately half of these related to bank consumer matters, banking policies and regulations, banknotes and coins, financial infrastructure, and debt market developments. The most frequent enquiries concerned the Coin Collection Programme, banking products and services, banking-related guidelines and circulars, and the Retail Bond Issuance Programme.

Figure 1 shows the total number of public enquires received since 2019, while Figure 2 lists the proportion of different types of enquires received in 2022.

Figure 1 Total Number of Public Enquiries

Figure 2 Proportion of Enquiries Received in 2022

# Publications

In addition to the HKMA Annual Report, the HKMA publishes two Half-Yearly Monetary and Financial Stability Reports and four Quarterly Bulletins, regularly updating the Monthly Statistical Bulletin with the latest and special information and analysis on Hong Kong's monetary, banking, and economic affairs. In addition, the HKMA published 17 inSight articles introducing important measures and policies of the HKMA, discussing issues of public concern.

The HKMA 2021 Annual Report won the Silver Award in the Non-Profit and Charitable Organisations category and the Certificate of Excellence in Social and Governance Reporting at the Hong Kong Management Association's Best Annual Reports Awards 2022.

# Corporate Website

The corporate website (www.hkma.gov.hk) provides more than 46,000 pages of English and simplified/traditional Chinese content, making it convenient for the public to access the latest information about the HKMA. The website also contains records of "Registered Institutions and Local Representative Offices Register" and "Registered Securities Personnel Register", as well as "Stored Value Facility Licensees Register" under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (PSSVFO). 

Since 2018, the HKMA has been gradually releasing financial data and key information available on its website through open application programming interfaces (open APIs). As of the end of 2022, the HKMA had launched a total of 148 sets of open APIs according to the planned schedule.

# Information Centre

The HKMA Information Centre located on the 55th floor of Two International Finance Centre is an essential facility for introducing the HKMA's work and enhancing public understanding of monetary and banking affairs. The centre consists of an exhibition hall and a library. The exhibition hall introduces the HKMA's work and the development of Hong Kong's monetary and banking sectors through interactive displays, and provides materials and exhibits for research on Hong Kong's monetary, banking, and financial affairs. Adjacent to the exhibition hall, the library houses over 26,000 books, journals, and publications covering topics such as Hong Kong's monetary system, banking, finance, and central banking. The library also maintains the "Registered Institutions and Local Representative Offices Register" and "Registered Securities Personnel Register" as required under the Banking Ordinance (BO), available for public reference.

With the gradual easing of pandemic restrictions, the Information Centre resumed public tour services in the second half of 2022.

After renovation, the new library reopened to the public in March 2023.

# Community Engagement and Public Education

To maintain community connections and enhance public awareness of the HKMA's work, the HKMA has been offering public education programmes since 1998. In 2022, the HKMA conducted webinars attended by over 2,200 participants from 82 secondary schools. Topics covered included an introduction to the HKMA's work, the LERS, Hong Kong banknotes, protecting personal digital keys, deposit insurance schemes, and opportunities in the banking sector. The public education programme has now recorded over 65,000 participants.

The HKMA educates the public on how to become informed and responsible consumers of financial services

The HKMA reminds the public about how to be vigilant against fraudulent SMS messages and emails containing fake links claiming to be from banks, and to be cautious of credit card scams and other types of fraud. The HKMA also conducts radio and social media campaigns to provide tips on using credit cards, personal loans, online shopping, and other payment methods, including Pay Later (Buy Now) products.

New short film titled "Digital Keys Are Watching, Think Twice Before Clicking Links!"

To help the public keep up with the development of fintech services, the HKMA promotes the distribution of electronic red envelopes during the Lunar New Year through social media and radio. The HKMA produced an animated short film explaining open APIs and highlighting considerations when using banking services via mobile applications provided by third-party service providers (such as online shopping platforms and mortgage companies). The animated short film also explains the App-to-App and Web-to-App payment features and benefits of Faster Payments.

The animated short film helps improve the public's digital financial knowledge

The HKMA also aims to deepen public understanding of the financial sector and increase interest among young people in joining the HKMA and the industry. In newly produced interview videos, graduates of the Manager Trainee (MT) Programme share their experiences, not only introducing the programme to those interested in applying but also enhancing their understanding of the HKMA's work.

MT Programme graduates sharing how to prepare for interviews

To improve secondary school students' financial literacy, the HKMA jointly organised the eighth consecutive "Hong Kong Financial Literacy Challenge". The theme this year was green and sustainable finance, with students absorbing new knowledge through online quizzes (with record participation), webinars, and design thinking competitions.

Students presenting creative solutions with green and sustainable elements to meet personal financial needs

# 外匯基金

- 審計署署長報告
- 外匯基金財務報表

# 審計署署長報告

# 獨立審計師報告致財政司司長

# 意見

茲證明我已審計列載於第179頁至281頁外匯基金及其附屬公司（「集團」）的財務報表，該等財務報表包括外匯基金及集團於2022年12月31日的資產負債表與截至該日止年度的收支帳目、全面收益表、權益變動表和現金流量表，以及財務報表的附註，包括主要會計政策概要。

我認為，該等財務報表已按照香港會計師公會頒布的《香港財務報告準則》真實而中肯地反映外匯基金及集團於2022年12月31日的財務狀況及截至該日止年度的財務表現和現金流量，並已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》（第66章）第7條下所發出的指示妥為擬備。

# 意見的基礎

我已按照行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示及審計署的審計準則進行審計。我根據該等準則而須承擔的責任，詳載於本報告「審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任」部分。根據該等準則，我獨立於集團，並已按該等準則履行其他道德責任。我相信，我所獲得的審計憑證是充足和適當地為我的審計意見提供基礎。

# 關鍵審計事項

關鍵審計事項是根據我的專業判斷，對截至2022年12月31日止年度財務報表的審計最為重要的事項。我對整體財務報表進行審計及形成意見時處理了這些事項，而我不會對這些事項提供單獨的意見。

# 按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.5、2.6及38.1。

於2022年12月31日，集團按公平值列帳的金融資產共38,361.82億港元，金融負債共12,074.98億港元。

87%的該等金融資產及所有該等金融負債的公平值為相同資產或負債於活躍市場的報價（第1級參數），或是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第2級參數）。

其餘13%的該等金融資產的公平值，是以估值方法估計，而所用的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎（第3級參數）。有關金融資產共4,876.94億港元，主要包括非上市投資基金。

鑑於所涉數額龐大及涉及估計，按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值屬關鍵審計事項。

就按公平值列帳的金融資產及金融負債的估值，審計程序包括：
- 了解不同類別金融資產及金融負債的估值程序，包括相關監控措施；
- 評價及測試監控措施，包括電腦系統的相關應用程式監控措施；
- 就金融資產及金融負債的估值、存在、權利與責任及完整性取得函證；
- 若使用市場報價，根據獨立來源核實價格；
- 若所用估值方法的參數是以可觀察市場數據為基礎，評價估值方法是否適合及有關假設是否合理，以及根據獨立來源核實參數；及
- 若所用估值方法的參數並非以可觀察市場數據為基礎，評價估值方法是否適合，以及有關假設與參數是否合理。

# 按公平值列帳的投資物業的估值

請參閱財務報表附註2.11、18及19。

集團的投資物業按公平值列帳，於2022年12月31日共值233.94億港元。集團亦於4間聯營公司及22間合營公司擁有權益，該等公司主要業務為持有海外投資物業，有關權益共值396.31億港元。不論是由集團直接持有或由聯營公司或合營公司持有，該等投資物業的公平值均主要根據獨立專業估值師的估值釐定。該等估值涉及重大判斷及估計，包括所用的估值方法及假設。

就按公平值列帳的投資物業的估值，審計程序包括：
- 獲取及審視由集團直接持有或由聯營公司或合營公司持有的投資物業的估值報告，並核實公平值是根據有關估值報告所列的估值釐定；
- 評估估值師的獨立性及資歷；及
- 評價估值方法是否適合，以及有關假設與參數是否合理。

# 其他資料

金融管理專員須對其他資料負責。其他資料包括金融管理局2022年年報內的所有資料，但不包括財務報表及我的審計師報告。

我對財務報表的意見並不涵蓋其他資料，我亦不對其他資料發表任何形式的鑒證結論。

就財務報表審計而言，我有責任閱讀其他資料，從而考慮其他資料是否與財務報表或我在審計過程中得悉的情況有重大矛盾，或者似乎存有重大錯誤陳述。基於我已執行的工作，如果我認為其他資料存有重大錯誤陳述，我需要報告該事實。在這方面，我沒有任何報告。

# 金融管理專員及外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會就財務報表而須承擔的責任

金融管理專員須負責按照香港會計師公會頒布的《香港財務報告準則》及行政長官在《外匯基金條例》第7條下所發出的指示擬備真實而中肯的財務報表，及落實其認為必要的內部控制， 使財務報表不存有因欺詐或錯誤而導致的重大錯誤陳述。

在擬備財務報表時，金融管理專員須負責評估集團持續經營的能力，以及在適用情況下披露與持續經營有關的事項，並以持續經營作為會計基礎。

外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會負責監督集團的財務報告過程。

# 審計師就財務報表審計而須承擔的責任

我的目標是就整體財務報表是否不存有任何因欺詐或錯誤而導致的重大錯誤陳述取得合理保證，並發出包括我意見的審計師報告。合理保證是高水平的保證，但不能確保按審計署審計準則進行的審計定能發現所存有的任何重大錯誤陳述。錯誤陳述可以由欺詐或錯誤引起，如果合理預期它們個別或滙總起來可能影響財務報表使用者所作出的經濟決定，則會被視作重大錯誤陳述。

在根據審計署審計準則進行審計的過程中，我會運用專業判斷並秉持專業懷疑態度。我亦會：
- 識別和評估因欺詐或錯誤而導致財務報表存有重大錯誤陳述的風險；設計及執行審計程序以應對這些風險；以及取得充足和適當的審計憑證，作為我意見的基礎。由於欺詐可能涉及串謀、偽造、蓄意遺漏、虛假陳述，或凌駕內部控制的情況，因此未能發現因欺詐而導致重大錯誤陳述的風險，較未能發現因錯誤而導致者為高；
- 了解與審計相關的內部控制，以設計適當的審計程序。然而，此舉並非旨在對集團內部控制的有效性發表意見；
- 評價金融管理專員所採用的會計政策是否恰當，以及其作出的會計估計和相關資料披露是否合理；
- 判定金融管理專員以持續經營作為會計基礎的做法是否恰當，並根據所得的審計憑證，判定是否存在與事件或情況有關，而且可能對集團持續經營的能力構成重大疑慮的重大不確定性。如果我認為存在重大不確定性，則有必要在審計師報告中請使用者留意財務報表中的相關資料披露。假若所披露的相關資料不足，我便須發出非無保留意見的審計師報告。我的結論是基於截至審計師報告日止所取得的審計憑證。然而，未來事件或情況可能導致集團不能繼續持續經營；
- 評價財務報表的整體列報方式、結構和內容，包括披露資料，以及財務報表是否中肯反映交易和事項；及
- 就集團中實體或業務活動的財務資料獲取充足和適當的審計憑證，以對財務報表發表意見。我負責指導、監督和執行集團審計。我對我的審計意見承擔全部責任。

我會與外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會溝通計劃的審計範圍和時間以及重大審計發現等事項，包括我在審計期間識別出內部控制的任何重大缺陷。

我亦會向外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會提交聲明，說明我已符合有關獨立性的相關道德要求，並與他們溝通所有被合理認為可能會影響我獨立性的關係和其他事項，以及在適用的情況下，相關的防範措施。

從與外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的審核委員會溝通的事項中，我會決定哪些事項對本期財務報表的審計最為重要，因而構成關鍵審計事項。我會在審計師報告中描述這些事項，除非法律法規不允許對某件事項作出公開披露，或在極端罕見的情況下，因為有合理預期在我報告中溝通某事項而造成的負面後果將會超過其產生的公眾利益而我決定不應在報告中溝通該事項。

# Exchange Fund

- Director of Audit's Report
- Exchange Fund Financial Statements

# Director of Audit's Report

# Independent Auditor's Report to the Financial Secretary

# Opinion

I have audited the financial statements of the Exchange Fund and its subsidiaries ("the Group") set out on pages 179 to 281. These financial statements include the balance sheets of the Exchange Fund and the Group as at 31 December 2022, and the income and expenditure accounts, statements of comprehensive income, statements of changes in equity, and statements of cash flows for the year ended on that date, together with the notes to the financial statements, including summaries of significant accounting policies.

In my opinion, these financial statements present fairly the financial position of the Exchange Fund and the Group as at 31 December 2022, and their financial performance and cash flows for the year then ended, in accordance with the Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards issued by the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants, and have been prepared in accordance with the instructions issued by the Chief Executive under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66).

# Basis of Opinion

The audit was conducted in accordance with the instructions issued by the Chief Executive under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance and the audit standards of the Audit Commission. My responsibilities relating to the audit of the financial statements are detailed in the section entitled "Responsibilities of the Auditor in Relation to the Audit of the Financial Statements" in this report. Under those standards, I am independent of the Group and have fulfilled other ethical responsibilities in accordance with those standards. I believe that the audit evidence I have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to support my audit opinion.

# Key Audit Matters

Key audit matters are those identified by my professional judgment as most significant in the audit of the financial statements for the year ended 31 December 2022. I have addressed these matters in conducting the overall audit and forming my opinion on the financial statements, but I do not provide separate opinions on these matters.

# Valuation of Financial Assets and Liabilities Measured at Fair Value

See Notes 2.5, 2.6 and 38.1 to the financial statements.

As at 31 December 2022, the Group had financial assets measured at fair value amounting to HK$3836.18 billion and financial liabilities measured at fair value amounting to HK$1207.49 billion.

87% of these financial assets and all of these financial liabilities were valued based on quoted prices in active markets (Level 1 inputs), or estimated using valuation techniques with parameters based on observable market data (Level 2 inputs).

The remaining 13% of these financial assets were valued using valuation techniques with parameters not based on observable market data (Level 3 inputs). These financial assets amounted to HK$487.69 billion, primarily comprising non-listed investment funds.

Given the large amounts involved and the estimation required, the valuation of financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value constitutes a key audit matter.

Audit procedures related to the valuation of financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value included:
- Understanding the valuation processes for different categories of financial assets and liabilities, including relevant control measures;
- Evaluating and testing control measures, including application controls over computer systems;
- Obtaining external confirmations regarding the valuation, existence, rights and obligations, and completeness of financial assets and liabilities;
- Verifying prices from independent sources if market quotations were used;
- Evaluating whether the valuation methods were appropriate and whether the assumptions were reasonable, and verifying the parameters from independent sources if the parameters were based on observable market data; and
- Evaluating whether the valuation methods were appropriate, and whether the assumptions and parameters were reasonable, if the parameters were not based on observable market data.

# Valuation of Investment Properties Measured at Fair Value

See Notes 2.11, 18 and 19 to the financial statements.

The Group's investment properties were measured at fair value, amounting to HK$23.39 billion as at 31 December 2022. The Group also held interests in four associates and 22 joint ventures, whose principal activities were holding overseas investment properties, with the interests amounting to HK$396.31 billion. Whether directly held by the Group or through associates or joint ventures, the fair values of these investment properties were mainly determined by valuations from independent professional valuers. These valuations involved significant judgments and estimates, including the valuation methods and assumptions used.

Audit procedures related to the valuation of investment properties measured at fair value included:
- Obtaining and reviewing valuation reports for investment properties directly held by the Group or through associates or joint ventures, and verifying that the fair values were determined according to the valuations stated in those reports;
- Assessing the independence and qualifications of the valuers; and
- Evaluating whether the valuation methods were appropriate, and whether the assumptions and parameters were reasonable.

# Other Information

The Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is responsible for other information. Other information includes all information contained in the Annual Report of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority for the year ended 31 December 2022, but does not include the financial statements or my auditor's report.

My opinion on the financial statements does not cover other information, and I do not express any form of assurance conclusion on other information.

In relation to the audit of the financial statements, I have a responsibility to read other information in order to consider whether other information is materially inconsistent with the financial statements or with information known during the audit, or appears to contain material misstatements. Based on the work I have performed, if I conclude that other information contains material misstatements, I would need to report this fact. In this regard, I have no such reports.

# Responsibilities of the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Audit Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee in Respect of the Financial Statements

The Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority is responsible for preparing financial statements that are fair and true in accordance with the Hong Kong Financial Reporting Standards issued by the Hong Kong Institute of Certified Public Accountants and the instructions issued by the Chief Executive under section 7 of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66). The Chief Executive is also responsible for implementing internal controls that he considers necessary to prevent material misstatements arising from fraud or error.

In preparing the financial statements, the Chief Executive is responsible for assessing the Group's ability to continue as a going concern, and disclosing matters relating to going concern where applicable, and for using going concern as the basis of accounting.

The Audit Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee is responsible for overseeing the Group's financial reporting process.

# Responsibilities of the Auditor in Relation to the Audit of the Financial Statements

My objective is to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the overall financial statements are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor's report that includes my opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but it cannot ensure that an audit conducted in accordance with the Audit Commission's audit standards will detect all material misstatements. A material misstatement may arise from fraud or error, and would be considered material if it is likely, individually or in aggregate, to affect the decisions of users of the financial statements.

In carrying out the audit in accordance with the Audit Commission's audit standards, I will apply professional judgment and maintain an attitude of professional skepticism. I will also:
- Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement due to fraud or error; design and perform audit procedures to address these risks; and obtain sufficient and appropriate audit evidence to support my opinion. Because fraud may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omission, or override of internal controls, the risk of not detecting material misstatements resulting from fraud is higher than the risk of not detecting material misstatements resulting from error;
- Understand the internal control relevant to the audit to design appropriate audit procedures. However, this does not constitute an opinion on the effectiveness of the Group's internal control;
- Evaluate whether the accounting policies adopted by the Chief Executive are appropriate, and whether the accounting estimates and related disclosures are reasonable;
- Determine whether the use of going concern as the basis of accounting by the Chief Executive is appropriate, and, based on the audit evidence obtained, determine whether there are material uncertainties related to events or conditions that could cast significant doubt on the Group's ability to continue as a going concern. If I conclude that there are material uncertainties, it is necessary to draw the attention of users to the relevant disclosures in the financial statements. If the relevant disclosures are insufficient, I must issue an auditor's report with a qualified opinion. My conclusions are based on the audit evidence obtained up to the date of the auditor's report. However, future events or conditions may cause the Group to be unable to continue as a going concern;
- Evaluate the overall presentation, structure, and content of the financial statements, including disclosure, and whether the financial statements fairly reflect the transactions and events;
- Obtain sufficient and appropriate audit evidence regarding the financial information of entities or business activities within the Group to form an opinion on the financial statements. I am responsible for directing, supervising, and performing the audit of the Group. I bear full responsibility for my audit opinion.

I will communicate with the Audit Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee regarding the scope and timing of the planned audit and major audit findings, including any significant deficiencies in internal control identified during the audit period.

I will also submit a statement to the Audit Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee indicating that I have complied with the relevant ethical requirements regarding independence, and communicate all relationships and other matters that I reasonably believe may affect my independence, as well as any preventive measures taken where applicable.

From the matters communicated with the Audit Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, I will determine which matters are most significant for the audit of the financial statements and therefore constitute key audit matters. I will describe these matters in the auditor's report, unless legal or regulatory restrictions prevent disclosure of a particular matter, or in exceptional circumstances where there is a reasonable expectation that communicating the matter in my report would result in negative consequences outweighing the public interest, in which case I will decide not to disclose the matter in the report.
